title: POCKIT AIR ALL-TERRAIN DEMO
description: The Pockit Air All-Terrain is an absolute travel essential, providing total convenience without compromising on comfort or style.
transcript: this is the GB pocket air all-terrain so here you see the Sun Visor that you can easily adjust however you want it in what position you want and it has UPF 50 protection so your child is going to be nicely protected when you look inside of the seat you see here the breathable mesh this mesh fabric will allow some air circulation that is most comfortable for your child the front wheels you have these two little buttons so you can unlock the front wheels so that you have them in Swift wheel mode and this way that will make your ride more comfortable when it s on a flat surface but on an all-terrain surface a little bit more rough terrain you re going to prefer to have it in the locked position the amazing part about the stroller is that it s ultra lightweight this thing only weighs 10.3 pounds which is pretty amazing and also the ultra compact fold let me show you you just push these two buttons and you go down you lock it in in the middle wrap up and that s it there you go to unlock it you have here this little hook you just unhook this throw the straw out push the two buttons again and go back up put Sun Visor and you re good to go the seat has a capacity from six months and going all the way up to 55 pounds this was actually the normal every day to day fold when you want to have an even more compact let s say you re flying with the stroller and you want it happens as small as possible that is also possible then you just push these two bodies lock the wheels in 1 2 that s it and then you do exactly the same thing just push the 2 buttons go down lock it in again in the middle and you re good to go then it s even smaller to unlock it you have this little hook just open it up fall out push the 2 buttons again and go back up put your canopy back and you re good to go so we have a nice accessory this little bag where you can put the stroller in once you fold it and then you just put it over your shoulder and you re good to go

the lightest and smallest options really making it an ultralight and Ultra compact setup but with this ultralight minimalism it does bring in some sacrifices so we ll get into that Music now at this seven yeah it s insane how small this thing gets your airline workers are pretty shocked when we collapse it as you normally are required to tag and Stow the stroller earlier on but we use it all the way up to the gate and then collapse it and store it right in the overhead now it s far smaller than most people s carry-on backpacks but you can fully collapse it and put it into if y all Ravine 17-inch laptop cankin bag the way the stroller is 10.4 pounds and while there are no carrying handles you can kind of just grab it by the handle when you carry it around quickly now for the design there are a lot of umbrella strollers out there you have the ones that collapse all together but I just absolutely love the Ingenuity of how compact this thing goes when you flip it all together now to do the collapse you have the two buttons on the top handles that you push together and then from there you ll do just a push together and collapse motion now you want to keep your wheels straight occasionally I ll still kind of have some issues if you don t have your wheels straight it won t fold up super easily now with that fold you have two fold patterns here there are hinges on the rear wheels that flip up and bring this lower wheel up into this space right in here for most instances this is plenty small so I usually don t worry about that but when we do the overhead storage we re stress do it away compact in your closet I ll go and do the extra method there after some practice flipping it out really is quite simple you have the lock in the middle you flip it left and right and then you ll just do a forward motion with the levers up and you do have a simple brake system on the back right wheel it s got a brake wire that runs from one wheel to the other so both Wheels do lock with the engagement of the right foot brake now getting into the ergonomics for the parent this stroller only has two height settings it s either tall or short and I m about the absolute Max height you can be I m six foot and the tall height is right at around the minimum of my comfort level if you re about five eight kind of the average height of a person that s really ideal setup and you can also drop it down lower if you re a little less gifted in stature but walking downhill as a six foot person you really start to lose the comfort and max out the size for this thing now the stroller does have this wire mesh sun visor but it really doesn t do anything unless the sun is directly overhead but I guess they just wanted to include it not adding much weight just flips down here on the back now looking at the comfort of the stroller for your kid or who s ever kid you happen to be pushing around stroller was designed for kids from six months up all the way to about 55 pounds you don t typically want babies younger than that as they won t be able to hold their head up very well and they ll have an age limit but typically five or six until you hit that 55 pound Mark then you re just putting too much stress on the stroller itself now you got the basic webbing straight wraps here and then the adjustable part of it is recessed behind the pads which are sewn into the straps here once you set it they re not really quick adjustment like your car seat you really just set it and then leave it there you also have a very slight adjustment down here on the bottom for your buckle but it s just got some a little bit of padding on the webbing itself now I do wish for this expensive of a stroller they would have gone with a higher quality webbing just something either a little bit softer and a finer and Tighter weave but it s not terrible it does a good job the bottom of the stroller does have a softer foam with the polyester cover here and then from the midways all the way up it s a clear mesh just to allow for more airflow less sweat for your child it s not going to be a good cold weather stroller unless you bundle them up quite a lot as the air will come through on the back of the stroller another feature that the stroller has mainly for the folding mechanism is these fret locks in the left and right Wheels this just keeps your wheel straight so when you do collapse it down you don t have any pivoting motion and then that s a little more reliable in the folding action you have the foot rest on the front which is one of the things I ve seen people break make sure if you have a larger child they re not jumping on this because if it does rip here you re gonna have to just cut off both sides and go without the foot plate with Twitter have your child s feet kind of dragon in the wheels and then you also have underneath a little storage container just for a brief say a little jacket or blanket any toys there and then we have a little ear tag that we have dangling down below so if we re flying a smaller plane and they request to take it out the gates we ve got a tracker on it we ve had so many Uber drivers taxi drivers stewardesses just we ll walk up and flip it they ll just kind of stare at it like whoa what happened so it s like a little Transformer of a stroller and just the weight overall it s it s incredibly lightweight now getting into the cons of this stroller first off this is a very Niche stroller focused on being ultra light and good for travel we ve also got a full-size Mockingbird stroller which has the little tray table for the baby and then addition to that we have a Thule running stroller more for jogging with larger Wheels uh quite a bit easier to roll and then while our child was the infant we used our Dune a lot for travel but when he outgrew that then we came into the pocket it would be hard for this to be your only stroller unless you really don t walk or use strollers very often anyways and the other huge con to be aware of is while this says it s the pocket air all-terrain this thing does not work at all on Sand if you push it there it just completely stops you kind of have to pull it backwards to get the weight off of it it also really struggles in thick grass like a thicker Zoysia it really is not made for that it does pretty well on like a rough asphalt a cobblestone you can get up and down curb pretty easily especially going backwards pulling it up and down stairs has been pretty good but it is not all terrain it s really focused on just the ultralight compact travel and city stroller and because this is such a light stroller you can really feel the aluminum flexing as you push it if you re going over cobblestones there is no suspension of any kind and the entire the entire stroller kind of just flexes back and forth even with the child in it as you push it feels kind of flimsy but it feels just like an ultralight camping chair as opposed to say a full-size lawn chair now we dug a lot into other people s reviews before I purchased it and from what I ve seen most people have very positive reviews but if you do break something say you break a wheel or you break the little strap for the child s feet there is terrible customer service and really no way to replace any of the parts now that part really sucks because you re paying almost 200 for the stroller you would hope that if it breaks you d get it fixed but it looks like you re going to be out of luck now despite these cons I have been super impressed and very satisfied with the overall design and use of the product the ultra compactness is really what I was searching for I knew it would come with the set prices that it has and for me being able to completely collapse it and pack it down and just store it in the over head is far more valuable than having a large plush stroller with suspension and the extra bonuses I think if you have your expectations sit accurately to what this product is and when it s not product can definitely streamline the traveling with a toddler experience so if you you already have your diaper bags and your carry-on bags having one much much smaller item to deal with has just made traveling that much easier now I would buy again the eight months I ve had it I ve been the very content customer and really no issues with it so let me know if you have any questions or comments on the product down below I ll be happy to get back with you so thank you for your time have a good day Music

title: Bugaboo Donkey 5 What to know before buying Bugaboo
description: In this video, you ll discover the Bugaboo Donkey 5 and learn about all its new features, improvements and styling options.
transcript: Music hi there my name is james and today we re taking a closer look at the new bugaboo donkey five the donkey five is the future ready picked for growing families who want to stay connected wherever they go with one or two kids what makes the bugaboo donkey so unique is that in just three clicks you can go from mono to duo or twin configuration allowing your siblings to be side by side the donkey five is your best companion combining a single stroller and double stroller into one that you can grow with your family from birth to toddler in this video i ll explain what s so great about the bugaboo donkey what s new on the donkey 5 and walk you through some of the great new features then finally let you know about the must-have accessories to help your parent and child adventures become that much better before we jump into what s new about the donkey 5 let s look at why the donkey is so unique bugaboo designer donkey has the spacious stroller that grows with your family the side basket is great for storing baby essentials and groceries up to 10 kilos its versatility means that in just three clicks you can go from mono to duo to twin it s the ingenious two child ride that helps siblings of different ages bond and share experiences side by side with the same amount of comfort on every stroll before moving on to the iconic features of the bugaboo donkey i want to emphasize that the bugaboo donkey is smaller than you think a lot of people wonder if the bugaboo donkey is a wide stroller and the easy answer is no it may look wide but only at 60 centimeters in mono and 74 centimeters in duo it will fit through any standard doorway like all bugaboo strollers the donkey features a number of iconic bugaboo elements let s take a look Music with over 20 years of innovation bugaboo have always combined practicality with beautiful design the donkey 5 was designed with comfort and versatility in mind the donkey 5 always provides the best comfort for your child the extendable canopy and the peekaboo window combined with the aerated mattress helps keep them cool when the sun is out see these large all-terrain wheels combined with the front swivel wheels and a side by side design the bugaboo donkey has a tight turning circle with an effortless push plus the wheels are puncture proof so you can roll over bumps and kerbs with ease safety is the next vital feature of any bugaboo stroller the quick click harness is a bugaboo innovation and it makes life safer and easier for everyone it keeps your baby safe and secure and makes taking them in and out easier for you the rotating carry handle is there for extra safety but also rotates 360 degrees letting you and your child get close to each other Music bugaboo wanted to make the donkey 5 even easier to use with an improved fold improved seat height and a breezy bassinet for extra ventilation making it more comfortable for parent and child whilst also bringing more vibrancy and colors to your stroll so let s jump into what s new with the bugaboo donkey 5. this smart window is what makes the breezy bassinet so special it helps with extra airflow so it s easier for your baby to regulate their natural body temperature and keep themselves cool in warm weather if you live in a colder climate bugaboo has planned for this with rigorous testing of winds of up to 50 kilometers per hour bugaboo is made extra sure that the window closes firmly to block any cold draft from coming in see these magnets they seal the window so your newborn baby stays cozy and warm it also doubles as a nice sneak peek of what s going on in the world around them the donkey five grows with you from birth to toddler let s switch to the donkey five seats Music check out how comfy the new and improved shoulder pads are bugaboo have raised the bassinet and seat height by three centimeters making the seat at 57 centimeters providing more protection for your child making them easier to reach and closer to you you can also adjust the view for the baby from facing the world to facing you Music depending on if your child is feeling active or sleepy you can recline the seat in three positions on top of this bugaboo have also made the folding and unfolding even easier the position of the buttons have moved forwards to the front of the handle making them easier to use when folding it s even easier by just using one finger Music when unfolding all you need is a simple lift Music the most visual upgrade is with the chassis and the fabrics the new sleek graphite color chassis has high quality matte finish and the fabrics themselves are also new and improved they re soft to touch yet durable and provide even more comfort for your child as well as coming in a wide range of new color options and while you re strolling you can now add the bugaboo cup holder and will board with the updated attachments allowing you more freedom and practicality while allowing the whole family to join in the adventure now for the most eye-catching part about the new donkey 5 strollers the colors colour has always been a massive part of bugaboo s design thinking from the start for the donkey 5 bugaboo have introduced a beautiful new colour palette for you to choose from the fabrics are also new and improved they re incredibly soft to touch yet durable and water repellent bugaboo has also made some beautiful yet subtle changes to the branding all in all a very sophisticated look bugaboo has some great accessories the must-haves are the cup holder and the wheel board these are just a few of the design details and must-have accessories with your donkey 5. there are more color options and accessories available on bugaboo.com there you have it the complete rundown of what makes the donkey 5 such a great stroller if you re looking for a spacious stroller with room to grow the donkey 5 is definitely for you if you re inspired and want to find out more head over to bugaboo.com or check out their other stroller videos thanks so much for tuning in my name is james and i hope to see you soon happy strolling you

It s called hytrel elastomer, that s what it s called, it adds too, it s like instead of like a metal spring but it enables you to have really good suspension on like all four wheels, but they have those on the two front wheels and you can see that there s really, the suspension which is going to make it easier to push around. So this is not an all-terrain stroller, you may want to get an all-terrain stroller in addition to this stroller, but in terms of a small stroller, pushes really well. This stroller does a really great job. Again, nice, nice good sized basket that you can access that holds up to about a little bit over 40 pounds of stuff that you can put in it. Easy brake on the bottom, little red brake, up and down. The BABYZEN YOYO2 is awesome, it s great, I love those upgrades. It may be the right stroller for you, it may not be, but I do a video of my favorite travel strollers, which you can watch right now.

title: Babyzen YOYO2 Stroller Review
description: Shop the Babyzen YOYO2 at Strolleria here In this video, we ll cover - Babyzen YOYO2 ...
transcript: Music hi I m Amy owner of stroll area and in this video i ll show you the babies and yoyo - if you have questions about the yo-yo - email us at customer care at stroller viacom or leave a comment below the babies and yoyo is a leading compact stroller that helps take the stress out of travel and everyday life it weighs less than 14 pounds fits in an overhead bin and can be carried on your shoulder but while the stroller is light it s also strong thanks to materials like aluminum alloy stainless steel and fiberglass that s what makes the yo-yo one of the most popular strollers in Europe where strollers need to be convenient enough for public transportation and durable enough for bumpy cobblestone roads new for 2020 is the yo-yo - which has new features like improved all wheel suspension and a leather at handlebar the yo-yo - is available at stroller recom for 550 let s take a look at the stroller the yo-yo - has new features that give it a more luxurious look and feel compared to the previous model which was called the yo-yo plus the yo-yo - provides the smoothest ride on any terrain thanks to its new independent four-wheel suspension that uses innovative technology developed by DuPont because of the upgraded suspension the stroller now has a higher weight limit the size of the seat hasn t changed and the yo-yo plus and yoyo - use the same seat fabrics and accessories additionally the handlebar is now a more durable leatherette instead of foam the harness is softer and more flexible and the buckle and recline buttons are easier to use the yo-yo - is one of the most compact strollers on the market and it needs carry-on requirements for all major airlines to fold the stroller first press the white buttons on the sides of the frame to fold the canopy down next find two folding triggers underneath the seat a red tab and a white button when you pull the tab and push the button the stroller collapses using one hand you can then carry the stroller from its integrated shoulder strap to unfold undo the lock at the front of the frame and spring the stroller back into place the frame of the yo-yo - is sold separately allowing it to be used with three different types of seating as your child grows you can use the stroller from birth by attaching an infant car seat with adapters or adding a bassinet which babies and calls the zero plus a newborn pack the newborn pack allows your infant to lie flat and includes a headrest five-point harness and a removable foot cover you can fold the stroller with the newborn pack attached once your baby is at least six months swap the newborn pack for the six plus color pack which includes the canopy and the seat fabric recline the seat pop-out the Sun Visor and use the canopy pocket to store your keys or phone to attach a car seat to the stroller first slide the lower portion of the car seat adaptors on to the sides of the frame then insert the upper portion of the adaptors into the car seat before folding the stroller press the white button on the adaptors to remove the car seat stroller can fold with the lower portion of the adaptors attached with adaptors the yo-yo 2 is compatible with infant car seats from Luna Cybex maxi Cosi and click a stroller frame for the OEO two comes in two colors black and white the seat and bassinet fabrics are available in nine colors allowing you to customize the look of your stroller all fabrics are easily removable and machine washable that s it for our review of the babies and yoyo - if you have questions about the yoyo - or need help finding the stroller that s right for you email us at customer care at stroller viacom or leave a comment below thanks for watching Music you

This is from newborn so when you use it with a Bugaboo Cocoon you can use it from newborn and the thing that s really cool about it, is that it goes in both directions. Let me show you how that works. The first thing you do is just put on the brake, okay, and what you do is you just push this down, push this in. Right in nice and compact like that and then you just fold it right over and then you just simply pull it right out. Just like that, turn it around, and set it back in. And it comes right back up, just like that. And now, your child can face you. It has three positions the lower, the middle, and the high. You may be getting this, you may already have an UPPAbaby Vista or a Bugaboo Fox or some other larger stroller or donkey maybe even and this may be a really good secondary stroller so the thing I like about this is when you have a travel stroller you very, very rarely have the baby facing you. And we all love looking at our babies, I know I m a father of three children. I love looking at my children when they re in the stroller. Let me show you how this turns back around. Push this down. Push this in. Really easy and then what you do is you just fold it right down. Like that. Pull it right out and it comes right back over. Cool. Pull the right back up and now you are ready to go. This has this beautiful pink melange canopy and they put a peekaboo window in their canopy. Thank you Bugaboo! Now they have a peekaboo window and it s also an extendable canopy. All you have to do is zip this open and now you have great sun protection with your baby. Let me show you how this folds. Again, what you do is you push this down, fold it in it, it folds in really easily. There not any levers or gadgets or anything. Just easily clicks in, there s this really snap solid click. You fold it right over and now what you do is you lift right here and this is one of the coolest parts of the stroller. It rolls! So if you re going through an airport or even if you re going from your house or your apartment into your car, you just like, roll it around. Super, super easy. When you re ready to fold it up, All you do, push this down and boom. Ready to go. This goes in the overhead compartment of the airplane. Do you have an away bag? I have those, those away luggage bags and this just reminds me of this nice hard shell. Really, really solid and one of the cool things about this as well is that, if you can see here, very, very smart engineering Bugaboo. They have this mesh little bag which takes a half of the basket. So what you can do is can put your stuff in here and you can still access your stuff. Toys, bottles, etc. right there. Access it right from the airplane. Let me show you how this opens back up. Lift this up, all the way and then it opens like that. And then just lift, boom. And you re good to go. Super high quality really, really solid stroller. More things to know about the Bugaboo Ant Number one, it has a fifty pound weight capacity! Lots of other strollers in that category have a forty pound weight capacity but this goes up to fifty pounds. Just you know, fifty pounds, about a five-year-old. Give or take, depending on the five-year-old and also this is car seat compatible. So, like I said before, you can use the Bugaboo Cocoon, with this to make it for newborn compatible but you could also add car seat adapters which work with a Nuna Pipa Lite. So another thing about the stroller that I absolutely love is is that umbrella strollers and small compact strollers typically have really, really minuscule basket. It s a complaint that we hear from customers all the time. This stroller has actually quite a large basket. Like I said before you have that mesh piece, that enables you to access it when you re in the overhead compartment of an airplane or when you have it folded down but what you can do is you just un-velcro this and now you have a, just a, giant basket to hold all of your stuff. Nice suspension in the front and on the back. You ll see that there are different sized wheels. There s those great, high quality wheels that Bugaboo is known for. It s also customizable, as many Bugaboo products are. So these, this hard shell on the side? That can be changed out. Right now I have it in the metallic but there are other colors available as well and also we have this nice, like I said, pink melange canopy. You have other, different color canopies that you can customize, also different fabrics. This stroller is launching with five options which you can learn more about at mbeans.com. title: Bugaboo Ant Stroller Review
description: Shop the Bugaboo Ant at Strolleria In this Bugaboo Ant stroller ...
transcript: Music hi I m Amy owner of stroll area and in this video I ll show you the new Bugaboo ant stroller the Bugaboo ant will be available to order in June 2019 at stroller Rio calm where we offer free shipping no sales tax and registry rewards if you have questions about the Bugaboo ant email us at customer care at stroller viacom or leave a comment below the ant is the smallest in the Bugaboo animal kingdom of strollers it weighs less than 16 pounds and fold so compactly that it fits into the overhead bin on an airplane just like an ant this stroller is tiny but tough it has all-wheel suspension built into the frame to give it a smooth ride and a sturdier seat and backrest than you ll see on most travel strollers it has a weight limit of 50 pounds and it can hold all the gear you need for your trip in its large storage basket which has an exterior pocket you can even access once the stroller is folded the amp starts at 4.99 and will be available to order in June 2019 from stroller EECOM the aunt is one of the only travel strollers with a reversible seat that allows the baby to face you when they re younger or forward when they re older it has a lever that allows you to recline the seat with one hand and the seat reclines to a flat position for newborns other travel strollers don t recline flat so they can t be used until the baby is around six months plus the aunt is one of the only travel strollers with a height adjustable handlebar for taller parents and a height adjustable seat for taller kids by pulling a tab on the back of the seat you can make the seat more compact for a small baby and taller for a toddler up to 50 pounds to fold the stroller push in the sides of the canopy until you hear a click on both sides push the seat down so it s at its shortest height pull the lever on the back of the seat and push it forward until it fits into the frame disengage the lock on the side of the stroller then push the wheels in to collapse the frame finally lower the handle bar until it locks in place now the aunt is the size of a carry-on you can pulled it with the seat facing either direction and you can trolley it like a suitcase when it s folded the ant is compatible with several car seats to make traveling with a baby a little bit easier using a car seat adapter sold separately you can attach the nuna pip a light or light LX and select car seats from maxi-cosi or Cybex at the time of this video that adapter did not fit the Bugaboo turtle or the nuna Pippa car seat because of their width will update our website when more information is available the ant comes in dozens of color combinations that allow you to give your stroller a custom look first choose from an aluminum or black base then choose your style set which includes the wheel caps side panel seat fabric and canopy that s it for our review of the Bugaboo ant stroller the Bugaboo ant will be available to order in June 2019 at stroller viacom where we offer free shipping no sales tax and registry rewards if you have questions about the Bugaboo ant or need help finding the stroller that s right for you email us at customer care at stroller viacom or leave a comment below you

accepted onto the boxer or rejects that they may have put a lot of work into and wanted to use in one form or another again I can t confirm this but the ironic thing if this hunch is true is that the key innovation of the boxer luggage system was the ability to adjust the chasis holding your suitcases for pushing rather than pulling well with the aunt they re doing the exact opposite in any case transcript: Music this is the upper baby vista v2 a full-size convertible stroller that can support up to three kiddos with a smooth ride and a slew of high-end details and accessories for around a thousand bucks you get all of this the stroller frame and wheels bassinet attachment bug shield bassinet storage bag the toddler seat attachment another bug shield and a rain shield too for reference that is a lot of included accessories so let s get into the stroller options you can stroll with one two or three babies of various ages and stages as a single you can start strolling from birth with the included bassinet or attach your own infant car seat with a separate car seat adapter unless you go with the uppababy mesa that connects without one then once baby can sit up on their own they can enjoy the toddler seat until they reach 50 pounds let s say you have two babies like twins congratulations by the way then you re in luck unlike other doubles say the mockingbird stroller the vista v2 can support two bassinets or two infant car seats at the same time you ll just need to purchase the extra bassinet now if you have two babies of different ages like i did you may be able to carry them both at once with what s right in the box at first but you ll likely end up buying a second seat or a rumble ride along with a set of adapters for when you have two toddlers and if you add a third to the bunch also like i did that s where the piggyback stroller board comes in having so many options can be cool but also a little confusing like you may not realize right away that there are different adapters for the upper and lower levels or that the second seat actually has a lower weight limit than the included toddler seat that being said uppa has an expansion tool on their website to help you visualize it all better while planning and once you ve found the configuration and accessories you like it s easy to get into the groove from day to day as for the stroller adjustments the toddler seat is modular so you can flip it forward or rear-facing and then you can recline it to whichever angle is most comfy for your little one just keep in mind that depending on how you line up the seats you may not be able to fully recline one of the seat as much as the other the ventilated and expandable canopies on both the bassinet and toddler seat have great visibility and airflow and on the toddler seat the canopy is height adjustable which is really helpful for taller kiddos like my lennox the storage basket is impressively large as in it can hold 20 more pounds of stuff than other comparable double strollers like the nuna demigrow and it s pretty easy to access despite the big bar going across the opening there s also a telescoping handlebar which is great for caretakers of varying heights and the stroll is really smooth and durable you can feel the premiumness here the shock shock-absorbing all-wheel suspension glides and turns with ease even as you add more kids and accessories pro tip for you parents with multiples put your heavier kiddo in the back seat parents have said it s really hard to steer with the weight mostly up front now having said that you do have the option to lock the front wheels for a little extra oomph as you manage the added weight or if you re riding on a rougher terrain speaking of weight like most double strollers the v2 is on the heavier side but you ll only need to worry about that for the few seconds that you re folding it down and loading it into the trunk otherwise you can just let it stand up on its own and once it s folded down with the toddler seat attached it s still relatively compact i ll wrap things up by saying the obvious this is a good looking stroller the real leather accents the great variety of color options it s almost hard to choose but what s cool is up a baby will send you four swatches of fabric for free to see which one you like the best before you buy they also offer a three year warranty and a travel safe program that covers damages if you register and gate check your stroller inside of the travel bag the looks are also functional the toddler seat has easy to adjust no re-thread harness straps and the bassinet has water-repellent aerated mattress that s so comfy you could even buy a separate stand and use it as a full-time newborn sleep space overall the uppababy vista v2 is a versatile beautiful workhorse an investment yeah worth it that s up to you i hope this helps Music you

around the seats the main toddler seat on the v2 is slightly larger with a higher 20 inch seat compared to the 19 incher from previous versions and it also has a deeper two and a half inch foot rest versus the two inches from the older gen they also introduced a non-rethread harness complete with straps that adjust a bit easier than before now one of the most notable changes has been the redesigned canopy and it is near perfect with older models the extended sunshade was tucked into the canopy which was convenient but it was also flimsy and it didn t offer that much more coverage with the v2 the canopy is made up of three panels most of the time the canopy will be extended to its standard two panel form but you can now unzip and expand that third panel and get that full coverage car seat though now that said it is important to note the differences between the toddler seat and the rumble seat which is smaller the toddler seat can accommodate kids up to 50 pounds whereas the rumble seat maxes out at only 35 pounds so if you have twins at some point when they get older one will sit a little bit more comfortably than the other now if you re not having twins this is ideal for two kids also i mentioned it before but the piggyback is a huge favorite of ours for us we most often go with the toddler seat and piggyback for our oldest as opposed to going with the double seats obviously the rumble seat and piggyback are extra accessories they don t come with the stroller but what does come included is the bassinet it s suitable for infants up to 20 pounds and it is rated sleep safe when used with their bassinet stand now from what i ve seen parents are split on whether or not they want to use the bassinet or just stick with the infant car seat the bassinet is of your preference it is nice that the bassinet is included though some may just set it aside unused on that note let s chat about car seats without the adapter the vista can take the uppababy mesa car seat which is what we mostly used for our first two kids it s great unless bundled it does come separate and it ll run you about 300 bucks now most parents i see will go in that direction for the size single stroller so you could see the seat height difference the other big design difference is the storage basket situation it s perched right up front rather than accessible from the back as you might be used to the cool thing though is that it completely closes to keep all the stuff you re carrying secure and it easily detaches it s about as big as my diaper bag the explorer can support your babe up to 48.5 pounds and be used from birth with an infant insert that s included please note this is the most cushiony and soft insert i ve ever felt i want it in adult form for myself there s also an explore a carrycot or infant car seat and adapters you can purchase separately to stroll with a newborn if you prefer the hard shell seat is modular meaning you can let baby face you or the world and there are a few recline and leg rest positions to try sleep rest and active living up to the exploring name the active position is completely upright and my son jet has definitely been doing a lot more exploring when seated like this it gives him such good visibility on everything around us he s probably also in a great mood though because he knows he looks good and those premium and eco-friendly fabrics this canopy is large quiet and extends for extra ventilation and the seat rail slides out of the way nice and easy too the premium details don t stop a baby though for parents there s a leatherette handlebar that is both height and angle adjustable so both my husband at 5 8 and myself at 5 6 can easily find a good spot and we won t bump our shins on the stroller bars only other thing is that adjusting the height of the harness straps require quite a few steps you have to use a key and a screwdriver to navigate the sturdy seat shell when you like to move the straps from one height to the next i d say to try to time the adjustment to when you need to remove and clean the seat fabrics because it s a lot of the same steps overall the stock explorer x is a modern and luxurious stroller with much more than just good looks at around 999 dollars it could be the only one your family needs from birth and beyond there are a lot of cool accessories you could try like the stroller boards and snack trays too hope this helps happy exploring Music you

title: Nuna Mixx Stroller Review - Babylist
description: The amazing suspension and stylish look make the 2019 Nuna Mixx stroller a parent favorite. Scout Julie details more!
transcript: if you re wanting to know the ins and outs of the 2019 nunavik stroller then you re in the right place I ve been using the stroller with my six-month-old and my three-year-old and I am obsessed with how incredibly smooth this stroller is the nuna mix is a full-sized single stroller that has all the amazing qualities you look for in a luxury stroller this version is an upgrade of their 2018 nuna mix2 model and it still has all the details that parents love about the nuna mix but now with some exciting updates the mix cost about 650 and features foam-filled tires and four-wheel suspension which makes it really incredibly smooth over all kinds of terrain and easy to maneuver with one hand with front wheels that lock for those bumpy or rides the stroller itself weighs about 27 pounds so not the lightest and can accommodate a child up to 50 pounds and up to 45 inches a stand out feature is that it s newborn ready it has a five position one-handed recline that has the ability to lay flat for a newborn and when you button up the footrest it creates a bassinet type environment for your little one so there s really no need to buy an additional bassinet for the stroller the insert can be removed to reveal a mesh seat back to keep baby cool in hot weather and the insert itself is made of a moisture wicking bamboo so it s nice and plush and cozy for those colder months the new no rethread harness makes it really easy to adjust as your child grows it has a reversible seat so your child can face you or face out into the world all by simply pressing these side buttons and switching it around not only that but the strollers two-step fold is quick and easy and you can fold it with the seat facing you or facing out the stroller opens pretty quick and effortlessly now let s talk about canopy because that s an area that I think that nuna really shines the mix has an oversized UPF 50 plus extendable canopy with a flip-out shade that can easily tuck back if you don t want to use it and if you unzip the zipper it reveals another panel with mesh sides giving your baby complete coverage for a cool and comfy ride there s also a peekaboo window with magnetic closure so it won t wake your baby if you go to check on them there s even yet another that reveals more mesh lining to allow for more airflow let s just say your baby will not complain about being hot in this Buffy other features include a 5 or three-point harness adjustable leg rest an easy flip-flop break two sided large storage basket that collapses for larger items a zipper area for keys or snacks and a pocket on the back perfect for your phone and an adjustable handlebar it s offered in a few different color options and features a brown leather at handlebar and child s arm bar it also includes a ring infant car seat adapter so you can easily turn this into a travel system using one of the nuna Pippa series of infant car seats additional accessories like a rain cover bassinet cup holder a child s tray travel bag can all be purchased separately all right let s recap what s to love about the 2019 noona mixed roller this is one luxurious ride for you and your baby those high-end details are not to be beat like the brown leather at handlebars the all-weather seat will keep your baby cool and summer with the mesh backing or cozy in the winter with a plush insert the seat can face you or the world and it can fold either way its newborn ready with the flat recline and a bassinet feature the large canopy offers full coverage and features multiple ventilation options a peekaboo window and a flip-out eye shade when folded it can trolley like a suitcase and lastly my six-foot-five husband loves how high the handle bar goes it truly is one of the highest and that s really good for two parents of vast height difference as for things to consider the rain cover is not included and I find that pretty necessary to use with the stroller so you re looking at spending an additional 40 which leads me to it s pricey for a single stroller that doesn t convert into a double and if you are hoping to use this with two children nuna doesn t offer a ride along board there is a company called lascal which makes a buggy board that is compatible with it you just have to check their site for the correct model and fit I m not a huge fan of the five-point harness I find it a little hard to connect especially hard when baby is crying I do wish the seat was a little deeper for my toddler and the stroller can only become a travel system using a nuna Pippa infant car seat no other brands are compatible lastly when it s folded it s not self-standing and it does take up a little bit of real estate overall this stroller is smoother than silk easy to maneuver with one hand and really comfortable for you and your baby hope this is helpful Music

title: 2021 Bumbleride Indie All Terrain Stroller - Demo Video
description: The Adventurer. An everyday stroller made for active families that care about responsible manufacturing. It s the only stroller you ll ...
transcript: Hi! This is Indie, the all-terrain stroller. We call it The Adventurer because it s purpose-built for active families. Let s talk about some of the unique features. Indie is infant ready without the use of any attachments, thanks to its deep recline and adjustable footrest audible clicks as footrest inclined . To set up Infant Mode , it s easier to remove the Bumper Bar first. Simply put your finger on the tab, below the bumper bar on each side of the frame and push in, to remove it. Next, unsnap the fabric from below the footrests on each side and attach to the side of the fabric. You will need to undo a snap from the frame to attach both snaps and repeat on the other side. If you d like, you can replace the Bumper Bar by putting it back into the slots on the frame. Now, Indie is infant ready. It also accommodates toddlers thanks to a large seat and extended foot well. You can also remove the rear portion of the canopy for additional airflow. Indie has an adjustable handle for all size parents sounds of handle clicking into positions . It comes with a jogging strap for hills and added safety. The canopy features a magnetic peekaboo window to check on your child or toggle up for more airflow. The canopy also features an extension pop-out for maximum sun coverage. The backrest features two large storage pockets and the oversized cargo basket has a pocket to store the included air pump. For added safety and comfort, Indie features a five-point breakaway harness with single button release. The harness can be adjusted as your child grows. Let s talk about some of the performance features. Indie features 12 inch air filled tires with all-wheel suspension. Indie s front wheel swivels 360 degrees for unparalleled maneuverability click sound of lock activating or locks for jogging sound of unlocking . What sets Bumbleride apart from the rest is our focus on eco materials. Our fabrics are 100 recycled PET from plastic water bottles Our frame features 25 plastics sourced from recycled fishing nets and our durable water repellent is PFC free. Our fabrics are also OEKO-TEX certified to be free from harmful chemicals To fold Indie, first adjust the bumper bar down and make sure make sure your front wheel is unlocked. Next, swivel the front wheel in front of you and look for the handle levers and squeeze. The stroller will fold down on its own and you ll hear it lock clicking sound of lock engaging thanks to its auto lock. We ve also got a quick-release for a more compact fold. Indie also features a standing stow for your garage or closet. To reopen the stroller, push the auto lock away from the frame and open the stroller in front of you. I d like to show you how to attach a bassinet or car seat adapter to Indie. The first step is to remove the canopy. You can also choose to remove the seat fabric if you d like. I m going to show you how to attach the car seat or Bassinet with the seat fabric on. First, remove your hinge slot covers on each side of the inside of the seat. Next, install the provided hot shoes and hardware with a Philips head screwdriver and repeat on the other side. Now you re ready to recline the backrest, remove the Bumper Bar, by pushing on the buttons on each side of the Bumper Bar, sliding it out. Now, you can attach your Bassinet or car seat adapters. To attach the Bassinet, locate the Hot Shoes and line up the receivers while you push down. To remove, locate the fabric handles and the grey buttons. Push and lift. To attach a car seat, first identify which adapter you need for your car seat. I m going to show you the clek, maxi cosi, Cybex, nuna adapters. Next, locate the right and left indicators when facing the front of the stroller and attach to each respective Hot Shoe. To attach a clek car seat, line up the adapters with the clek receivers and push down audible clicks of latching adapters . To remove, locate the release lever, pull, and lift up. When you re no longer using the car seat and you re ready to fold the stroller, make sure to remove the adapters by pushing on the grey button and lifting up, on each side. If you have the fabric removed, you do not need to remove the adapters, to fold the stroller. If you have any questions or concerns about car seat compatibility please call or email kandi bumbleride.com or 1-800 530 3930

title: Bumbleride Indie Jogging Stroller How To EVERYTHING YOU NEED TO KNOW
description: Check out the Indie Jogger here The Bumbleride Indie is the perfect stroller for ...
transcript: The Bumbleride Indie features a large canopy with an extra pop-out visor for more protection it also has magnetic peekaboo window which can roll up and out of the way if needed there is a pocket located in the back of the canopy for phones, keys and other items to adjust the height of the handlebar press the black buttons on either side and move the handle up or down to your preferred height there are even more storage options throughout the stroller with a medium and small pocket located in the back of the seat and a small zippered pocket in the basket for storing a small pump in case of a flat To recline the seat squeeze the clip and move it down the length of the tether to your prefer to recline and allow the seat to fall back to incline the seat squeeze the clip again and move it up the length of the tether the seat of the Indie can convert into a makeshift bassinet fully recline the seat and then adjust the footrest to its upright position you can then extend the canopy for full coverage if needed The belly bar of the indie adjusts up, down or can be completely removed to adjust it press the gray buttons located on the inside of the bar to release the lock to remove it press the black tab located on the underside of the frame and pull the belly bar up and out the cover of the belly bar easily zips on or off for easy cleaning of the cover and the pad beneath the footrest has a few different height setting move it up to your desired height and move it back down by pressing the gray buttons located on each side The brakes for Indy is your regular foot brake press down on it to break the stroller and move it back up to release the brake For jogging or rough terrain the Indie has a lockable front wheel move the ball into the slot on the front and spin the wheel until it locks in place to release the lock move the ball out of the slot The Indie features all wheel suspension to accommodate both jogger and all-terrain users To fold the Indie first break the stroller so that it doesn t get away from you then move the belly bar all the way down pull up on the gray fold tabs on either side of the frame the stroller will automatically lock in and even stand in place once folded to unfold release the lock on the side and bring the stroller back up to its upright position when using the indy for jogging or on rough terrain it is always recommended to use the attached wrist tether on the handlebar in case the jogger ever gets away from you hi guys thanks so much for watching our bumbleride indie how to if you enjoyed this video don t forget to like it down below and tell us what you think and then don t forget to subscribe to our channel where we have lots of fun things like reviews more how to that even gender reveals if you want to shop the products go to babycubby.com and search bumbleride Indie and we ll see you soon

Vista V3 when you re looking at the cruise one of the benefits of going with the cruise is that it s slightly smaller a little bit lighter and it is 200 savings I love that you still can use all of talked to a lot of moms on Instagram the cruise was just a better option to start out with not knowing what your family is going to look like in the future I think overall I love the cruise I wish it had a one-handed fold and I wish it was just a little bit lighter but I think this is an amazing stroller for your family the quality is amazing of UPA baby the versatility with all the different car title: UPPAbaby CRUZ V2 Stroller Review
description: Shop the UPPAbaby CRUZ V2 from Strolleria here! Questions ...
transcript: hi I m Amy owner of stroll area we re at the ABC Kids Expo in Las Vegas showing you the 20 20 up oh baby cruise v2 the cruise v2 is coming to stroller e-comm in February 2020 if you have questions about the cruise email us at customer care at stroller viacom or leave a comment below in February 20 20 the UPPAbaby Cruise is going bigger on its features and smaller in its fold the cruise b2 has larger wheels with added suspension and a larger seat for a growing toddler plus it folds smaller than before it also has new features like a redesigned canopy a larger storage basket and new colors as in years past the cruise is a single stroller that s easy to fold easy to use with a car seat or bassinet and has great quality with a three-year warranty the price of the 2020 Cruz is 649 to 679 depending on colors let s take a look at the new features the 2020 Cruise has larger wheels and improved suspension which makes the stroller easier to maneuver over uneven terrain like grass gravel and snow the cruise v2 now has suspension in all four wheels instead of just the front wheels previously with Springs that function independently to provide the smoothest ride good news for parents of tall kids the 2020 Cruise has a bigger seat for a growing child the seat back and the leg rest are two inches longer and the footrest is 1 2 inch deeper the canopy also slides up to create more head space as your child grows plus the seat harness is now no rethread so you can simply slide the harness up and down for easier height adjustments the v-2 stroller has a redesigned canopy with additional fabric that zips out for a peekaboo window incomplete Sun cartridge you can open a second flap at the front of the canopy for even more ventilation the 2020 cruise also has a new basket with a more streamlined design more storage space up to 30 pounds and a new pocket it also has a new foot brake that s better for wearing sandals Music the 20 20 Cruz comes in for new colors Alice dusty pink with saddle leather fin deep sea with chestnut leather hazel olive green with saddle leather and Sierra do knit with black leather these colors from last year are continuing for 2020 with the new features Loic white is changing - Bryce white marl with chestnut leather Emmett green melange with saddle leather Gregory a blue melange with saddle leather jordan charcoal melange with black leather and Jake black with black leather the cruise v2 has a reversible seat that allows your baby to face you or face forward you can recline the seat to multiple positions adjust the handlebar and adjust the footrest to add comfort add a car seat to create a travel system or attach a bassinet sold separately for a newborn the cruise v2 is 3 inches shorter in height when folded making it easier to carry and store in your trunk it also has a new lock that s easier to use and sturdier than before to fold the stroller apply the foot brake and lower the handlebar to its lowest position pull up on the triggers and pull the frame toward you adjust the footrest for a more compact fold to open the stroller simply undo the lock on the side of the frame and lift it back into place the cruise v2 is compatible with car seats from UPPAbaby and several other brands the UPPAbaby mesa is the only car seat that doesn t require car seat adaptors you can attach the mesa directly to the frame of the stroller and remove it by pressing the button on top of the car seat handle if you purchase car seat adapters the cruise is also compatible with car seats from nuna maxi cosi Cybex Kleck peg cargo and Keiko that s it for our review of the 2020 UPPAbaby cruise v2 if you have questions about the cruise or need help finding the stroller that s right for you email us at customer care at rollory accom or leave a comment below thanks for watching Music

title: What to Look for When Buying a Used Mountain Buggy Terrain
description: To support our work, visit PLEASE SUBSCRIBE! Subscribing helps preserve the ...
transcript: this is the Mountain Buggy terrain and it s quite popular these days because it s seen as a jogging stroller and it has certain functions that allow it to be used as a jogging stroller um it can have a lot of the same sorts of problems as the urban jungle model and I just wanted to go over the chassis and kind of point out some of the areas where you might have problems and suggest some solutions for maintenance and for fixing these problems and so on as well as what to expect from this stroller so beginning with the front wheel on mountain buggy this is often a problem actually any three wheel stroller that has a swivel front wheel often has problems with the mechanism the mechanism is made mostly of metal so it s pretty sturdy but you are going to want to pop off this top with a small screwdriver and oil in here and also from time to time tighten the nut which is under there in order to um keep this Fork tight this one s a bit loose now you can see so I m going to be tightening that afterwards another area of problem commonly with the newer Mountain Buggy strollers in particular is the ball bearings and so with the front wheel the ball bearing is in here and you ll want to oil that regularly as well you ll also want to oil through the center of the wheel where the axle goes if you don t for a while and it starts to rust it can be very hard to remove the axle and fix problems later this will make eventual repairs more expensive moving towards the back side of the stroller the other common area that has a problem with the terrain in particular is the hand brake system so if we remove this wheel you can see that the handbrake system runs down to this rubber um caliper that pushes up on this metal disc here and the problem is that there is a little bit of wiggle room with the axle as well as as I said before common problems with the ball bearings and this means that the wheel when it s in place tends to lean forward onto the rubber caliper and it makes a winding noise As you move so this is a problem that s just going to occur with this stroller and the best thing you can do to alleviate this is to not expect very much from how hard the handbrake will work if you keep the hand brake tight enough so that when you re going down a hill it will slowly come to a stop then you re fine then the rubber caliper will be far enough from the wheel that it won t make that noise but if you expect a sudden stop then this is not the stroller for you because the brake system is not designed to handle that in addition if you notice that the brakes are starting to get a bit tight you ll want to oil inside the brake wires and you can find the the several joints along the brake wire system where you can unscrew things and spray a little bit of spray grease like WD-40 down inside and that will fix those problems otherwise besides the hand brakes and the front wheel um this chassis is going to more or less get the same sorts of problems as the urban jungle in general it s a very good chassis it s uh made of relatively quality materials and very simple design but there are a number of plastic parts and these can break so in that case one would need to order new parts and replace them but that s relatively easy sometimes you ll have to drill out a rivet here and there but otherwise it s pretty straightforward as usual if you have any questions or comments feel free to leave them below and if you have any problems specifically related to the stroller also contact us and we ll try to help you thank you

title: B-Lively Stroller Instructional Video
transcript: hey everyone Erica from vertex here today I m going to show you how to put together and use your be lively stroller so let s start by opening the frame you ll need to push the release on the chassis lock then simply lift the handle until the frame locks into an upright position now to install the front wheels slide the front wheel assembly onto the mounting post at the front of the stroller be sure to pull on the wheels to make sure it s secure to remove the front wheel pinch the release button at the bottom of the mounting post and pull the wheel away from the stroller to install the rear wheels slide the rear wheel axle into the hub mounting bracket until it locks into place again pull on the wheel to be sure it s secure repeat for the other side to remove the rear wheels pull the lever away from the frame and pull the wheel out of the bracket now onto the canopy slide the canopy brackets into the stroller frame mounts until they lock into place pull the inner canopy flap over the back of the stroller and secure the hook and loop fasteners to the stroller drape the outer canopy back flap over the inner canopy flap and secure the hook and loop fasteners along each side of the outer canopy flap to the stroller seat attach the hook and loop fasteners on each side of the canopy to the inside of the stroller frame now that the stroller is all put together let s talk about how to use the features on your be lively stroller the stroller folds easily so you can quickly store it and get on with your day simply press and release the frame release button lift the frame release strap in the middle of the seat until the stroller collapses and the chassis lock engages now to unfold the stroller you ll want to push the release on the chassis lock and open the frame lift the handle until the frame locks into the upright position to use the parking brake simply press the brake pedal down to lock it this will lock both back wheels simply lift the brake pedal to release the brake to use the front wheel swivel locks press the swivel lock levers down lift the swivel lock levers up to allow the wheel to swivel to reclaim the stroller pull the recline adjuster release lever and slide it away from the seat to raise pull both straps apart to access the storage basket from the front of the stroller pull up on the tab found at the bottom of the calf rest now on to the harness first align the tongues on the waist straps with the retainers of the shoulder straps and slide through until they lock into place insert the tongues into the buckle assembly until you hear a click you when you want to use the stroller as a travel system you ll first need to attach the infant carseat receivers align the receivers with the mounts on the inside frame of the stroller then push down until you hear a click pull up on the receivers to be sure they re secure attach the snap on the receiver strap to the snap on the stroller seat strap inside the frame pull up on the receivers to be sure they re secure next be sure your parking brake is locked attach your protects infant car seat by lining up the adapter on the infant car seat with the receivers on the stroller lift up on the infant car seat to be sure it s secure to remove the infant car seat receivers unsnap the receiver strap from the stroller seat snap press the button on the receiver and lift upward repeat for the other side we hope you enjoy your new stroller to learn more about this and other great protects gear visit us at protects calm

title: Peg Perego Ypsi Review MadeForMums
description: Our MFM reviewer has been testing the Peg Perego Ypsi pushchair with her 5-month-old daughter.
transcript: I m rakeesha and I ve been testing Peg Perego s new Ypsi pram system from made for mums I ve been using both the bassinet and the seat unit with my five month old daughter first I m going to talk about the bassinet or carry car as a no song we ll call it I really like the different apron for this it can attach to the hood using tiny velcro tabs to help give your little one some privacy when they re sleeping or when you prefer for strangers not to peek in my favorite feature of the bassinet is the adjustable backrest it can set to three different positions included the recommended light a flat position but when she s not sleepy or sleeping I keep it on the most upright position so my daughter can have a better view of the world another great feature is the hood which is a really good size and offers UPF 50 plus protection it also has a flip-out ventilation panel to allow plenty of airflow through the baby I do in the warmer months so baby doesn t overheat the seat can be placed in both parent facing and world facing position as my baby is still quite young I prefer using the parent facing option for now in both ways the cecum clients have three different positions sitting relaxing and resting my favorite feature of the seat unit is the hood it offers a UPF 50 plus protection and also has a zipper extension the zipper extension is really cool when my little one is sleeping it helps block out noise and also sunlight I really loved the size of the basket I can fit lots in it including my nursing pillow which is pretty bulky the size expand a little for maximum storage I don t have any fear of anything slipping out the ipsy handlebar can be adjusted to three different heights so whoever was pushing it where its grandparents mom dad maybe older siblings they should be able to find a height that is comfortable for them I also want to highlight just how great it is to push and maneuver it tackles multiple surfaces with ease thanks to its great suspension as the wheels are mounted on 12th all bearings the roads and pavements now my home are pretty uneven and bumpy but the ipsy takes them on like a pro

like wow you hear the material it does feel like it s lacking a little bit of that gusto that i want from a comfort standpoint you know i think your child is going to sit in it just fine but you can tell that the cushioning is just a little bit thinner compared to some of those premium options and lacks a little bit more rigidity it s got a basic three-point harness that s easy to adjust so you know no issues there and it s got that padded crossbar which unfortunately does have to either be completely on or off altogether you can t just like leave it hanging half off uh making that a little bit more of an inconvenience whereas mockingbird lets you do that the footrest at the bottom can be adjusted similarly to the handle but for me the buttons do stick a little bit uh once i get the buttons pressed down it often feels like you know i want like a third hand to move the footrest sometimes i ll just use my head um i feel like that could be a little bit smoother especially in comparison to other brands now the canopy is alright it offers a peep window at the top but no magnets to keep it down so it can tend to flail a little bit in the wind so ding there not major though i d say the main downside is just a lack of an extended sun shade which i m sure some parents might be a little bit bummed about so if you re walking west on a late evening stroll uh there s a good chance that that sun is gonna be dipping down coming into your child s face a little bit and might be a bit bothersome so up to this point the stroller seems like a pretty simple budget friendly option that s you know not outstanding but still a very serviceable pick that many families are going to get great use out of but where it shines is its ability to expand to a double without the use of adapters versatility that is what parents are going to love here to get it into a double you start by popping off the seat and sliding the adapters up the frame next at the bottom toward the front of the basket is a button to release the lower adapters they pop out easy and with the seconds you can expand to a double hence its name without having to track down and snap on adapters which i love just a heads up though lining up the car seat and toddler seat to snap into the stroller was way more difficult than other strollers that i ve used it definitely took a little bit more time for me to get used to that uh i feel like that could be improved if they ever did like a v2 of the stroller you can make multiple configurations both forward and rear-facing and with evenflo s rider board it can carry up to three kids which is great haven t used that but might be a worthy pickup i did mention it comes with a safe max car seat but if you want it can adapt to others including the kiko key fit greco snug ride click connect and and more so go ahead and check out the description for more on compatibility with infant car seats the last thing i ll hit on here is yet another way evenflo added even more versatility with innovative design that s how the toddler seat can actually become a bassinet so that s yet another add-on that you need not worry about i will say though that my experience using it as a vest and it is lacking a bit so i can t say too much more on that but if there are any existing users out there that have thoughts on that please share that below moving down the storage capacity of the basket is great the back is a little bit more shallow but can easily accommodate large diaper bags and more it is specked at a max payload of 10 pounds but it took a 25 pound dumbbell pretty well at the back is your single pedal brake nothing too crazy there it works great but let s move on to the push now unlike mockingbird s rubber wheels the expands are foam filled plastic cruiser tires now these wheels they re going to wear on you a little bit and won t be able to accommodate as much terrain so cobblestone gravel and dirt paths they re not going to be ideal environments for this there is no locking mechanism to keep the the front wheel straight so it ll always have that swivel some don t really care about that uh but just something to note overall i d say that the push is smoother than you know say the maxi cosi zelia but definitely not as smooth as your nunas of the world also the stroller is on the heavier side at about 28 pounds so when fully loaded as a double you ll definitely feel more resistance on turns compared to strollers with wheels boasting a larger circumference at the back so that s a look at the stroller i ve got it linked below buying through that link by the way help support this channel it s at no additional cost to you but the question is should you actually click through that link and buy the stroller let s go ahead and unpack that a little bit if you re the kind of person that s like you know this is what i can afford i don t really care i just need a stroller right to push baby from point a to point b the expand is gonna be a solid pickup for you you know i d say for its price point it ll be the best that you can get it s not without its issues though while a ton of parents have had great experiences with it i ve also heard from a good many that have basically said that you kind of get what you pay for and it ll cost you more and trying to get it fixed or parts replaced and they regret not just making the jump to a premium option right from the start so from a quality standpoint the higher cost of you know a baby jogger up a cruise or you know nuna mix and other options like that they re going to deliver on better comfort materials durability and then sometimes design but what about the one that i m asked about the most one of my personal favorites mockingbird if you re asking me which is a better purchase i would say that the expand is probably going to give you a lot more value you re getting so much for such a good price that said mockingbird is definitely a better stroller to me it s a lot more durable and pushes and feels like a premium stroller while still being under that 500 mark you re still spending a little bit more because you can t buy it as an entire you know travel system but i think it is worth it while still not pushing up past that 700 mark that s all i ve got for you guys if you found this video helpful smash that like button down there looks like a thumbs up for more videos and reviews for new parents please consider subscribing to our youtube channel and thank you for helping us hit a hundred thousand subscribers god bless we ll catch you later

title: Uppababy Cruz V2 vs Joolz Hub Mechanics, Comfort, Use
description: In order to keep our recommendations up to date, we maintain a Buyer s Guide with a wide spectrum of models, and a lot of ...
transcript: today we re going to do a basic comparison between the jules hub plus and the upper baby cruise v2 which we ve received several requests to compare due to their relatively similar features and dimensions we re big fans of both of these models and though there are important differences in particular with regards to which lifestyle factors you should consider when choosing between them both are constructed in a very robust manner and for this reason i won t be going into chassis structure and longevity today they re both simply built to last and if you d like to know about these aspects you should check out our standalone reviews for each model so let s get started then with the hub plus where i d first like to point out that despite using some footage of the nearly identical original hub in this video all of the information relates to the current hub plus model the hub plus clocks in at 11 kilos and folds down to 31 by 53 by 63 centimeters with the seat attached which is sufficiently compact the result of the seat s ability to fold as well to be carried by the model shoulder strap when needed though it is still a bit too heavy to do this for long distances as far as child comfort is concerned the hub plus seat has a near full life flat position and is newborn compatible by using either a bassinet or a padded cocoon but is unfortunately a bit on the small side and as such will really only be ideal for use for children younger than two and a half or three when it comes to real world use and which lifestyles the hub plus will be best suited for the model is primarily for urban conditions where its smaller size excels at navigating crowded spaces and taking up less storage room while still providing the full-size comforts of a reversible seat and the sturdiness and terrain capability needed to hold up to regular all-day use while tackling occasional gravel broken sidewalks and city parks the model s large rear wheels and decent suspension help a lot here while its front wheels at 6.3 inches will be the chief limiting factor determining where you can drive and while the hub plus is perfectly capable of handling the conditions i described it will still struggle to deal with nature trails or really rough cobblestones storage wise the hub plus shopping basket is pretty limited capable of fitting a bit of necessary baby gear but not designed to handle a full picnic load or a ton of shopping a situation that should not be hacked by hanging heavy bags from the handle lastly while the hub plus can work as a keep in the trunk model in my experience for most heavily car based lifestyles such as in suburban america you can usually get away with something a bit lighter and smaller and where this model fits perfectly instead where you ll get the most out of its capabilities is in big cities with a lot of stairs and public transport and the like in particular in colder parts of the world where you ll need to deal with a bit of snow moving on the cruise v2 weighs in at 11.5 kilos and folds down to 42 by 58 by 84 centimeters with the seat attached which is only a tad heavier than the hub plus but significantly larger being more of a midsize model in this respect and which is a fine size for fitting in the trunk but not for carrying around when it comes to child comfort the cruise v2 has a bucket seat with an adjustable leg rest that is larger than the seat on the hub plus extending ideal use by up to a year or so as a bucket seat the cruise v2 doesn t offer a full life flat position but like the hub plus the model is also pairable with an infant insert or a bassinet for use with newborns when it comes to parent comfort and ideal lifestyle the cruise v2 7-inch front wheels and incredible suspension struts one of the best suspension setups on the market definitely give it an edge over the hub plus for terrain capability though it will still be best to think of the model as meant mainly for around town driving and if you re headed off-road it should be to relatively well-maintained trails and dirt roads the cruise v2 also has significantly more storage capacity than the hub plus in fact it has a bigger basket than the majority of mid-size models out there and combined with its increased seat size and terrain capability the cruise v2 is simply a much better all-round model than the hub plus ideal for people who will need their stroller for more than just short trips while still not being so large or heavy as to be difficult to fit in the trunk or carry up the stairs when needed and if you re trying to decide between these two models then i would say that the cruise v2 is the more versatile choice and the one i would recommend for most people unless you have special need of a small folding model such as you drive a very small car or have severely limited storage space you know that you need a stroller that is easier to carry on a regular basis while moving through the world or you have special reasons for needing the hubplus s more adjustable seat recline in any case we hope you found this video useful and if you did we ask that you subscribe as it helps us to continue making videos in the future if you d like to know more about either of these models we have standalone reviews for both of them and links have been added in the description in addition if you are currently shopping for a stroller we have a buyer s guide on our patreon page which lists a wide range of models that we recommend with a lot of technical and lifestyle related information you can find that by following the link in the description as well thank you
