title: Britax B-Free Stroller - Long Term Review 2 years later
description: Long term review of the Britax B-Free stroller after two years of use in Chicago and Southern California. Interested in any of the ...
transcript: hi moms and dads katie here and today i want to talk to you all about my stroller the britax be free my husband and i did so much research about two years ago when we were searching for a stroller and now that our daughter is 18 months old i want to talk about the good and the bad let s get started Music so in the past two years we ve lived in chicago and now here in southern california and i really have not seen a lot of moms pushing the stroller around and i m trying to figure out why because if you want a good napping stroller one with tons of storage and want to buy just one stroller this one s for you we started using the be free from day one with eliza through the travel system now if this is your first time buying a stroller like it was for us and have no idea what a travel system is it basically is an infant car seat that clicks into a stroller this is perfect so you can transport baby from car to stroller without waking him or her up we paired the be free with the britax endeavor car seat which is one of the highest rated car seats on the market we bought this as a travel system so it came with the adapters britax also sells other adapters that are compatible with other brand name car seats now the be free is unique because it has this canopy shade with a zippered extension that covers almost the full length of the seat not only is that amazing sun protection it acts as blackout shape from babies trying to nap on the go when eliza was an infant the sun shade from the car seat plus the canopy on the stroller created this little black room that plus a sound machine and she took great naps on the go and that was super helpful whenever i needed to run errands or meet with friends without the noise or light from surroundings bothering her and it never got too hot in there for her with the canopy drawn because there s this little mesh peekaboo window at the top so you can keep eyes on baby it s a magnetic closure so the sound of velcro won t wake baby up and now that she s older the befree has an infinite recline seat that lays almost entirely flat to keep baby girl comfortable my second favorite part about the be free is the amount of storage it has seven different compartments behind the seat is zippered storage that s perfect for wipes hand sanitizer and snacks and there are pockets to hold your keys and your phone there are also hidden zippered pockets in the basket underneath to hold more personal items and that basket underneath is huge it even fits my extra large diaper bag and when i would walk to the store in chicago it would fit a ton of groceries and the best part is that it s accessible from the front so you don t have to take everything out to reach the items you stored first and my husband s favorite feature the adjustable handlebar i know what a dork but to be fair he s 6 4 and i m 5 8 so that was really important to us the handlebar goes much lower so it can easily accommodate any height the stroller also comes with a one-handed fold which is really convenient because let s face it we ve all got our hands full you just push this button and pull the center handle and the stroller folds right up and with that adjustable handlebar it stands upright if you release this lever the stroller opens back up easily and the seat comes attached so you don t have to remove that separately as for the specs the b3 accommodates babies from birth in the travel system to about 65 pounds we were able to put eliza in the stroller without using a car seat right around four months the stroller weighs about 22 pounds so i want to say that s in the middle when it comes to stroller weight it s not as light as some of the travel strollers out there but also not as heavy as some of the more popular models plus it s about several hundred dollars cheaper it has a three wheel configuration for easy maneuvering and all-terrain rubber tires these held up very very well during chicago winters with all the snow and ice we get plus i have no problem pushing this through grassy fields in your playgrounds now to the cons back when we used to travel pre-covered i d give this stroller about an 8 out of 10 when trying to get through an airport i love it for the napping aspect but you do have to take the wheels off to fit it onto the security belt and when we would check the stroller at the gate we d also have to take the wheels off to fit it into our stroller bag which honestly wasn t that big of a deal because the wheels are pretty easy to take off the stroller also doesn t come with a cup holder but what i did was attach this stroller caddy that fits my extra large water bottle and comes with this handy zippered mommy pouch you need something pretty flexible so that it doesn t lose its shape when you pull the stroller up i ll put a link to that in the description box below if you re interested alright guys i hope you found this review helpful two years later i can honestly say that i would buy the same exact stroller again i did see that britax recently came out with the be free premium i haven t personally seen it but just by reading some of the specs it comes with the stain resistant fabric that handlebar is made out of leather and the canopy comes ventilated but in my opinion you lose some of that blackout feature that i love so much if you re interested in learning more i ll put a link to that stroller in the description box below so as you can see i m new here let me know in the comments if there are other videos you d like to see and if you did like this video i d appreciate it so much if you hit that subscribe button until the next one bye you

title: Cybex E-Priam Mini Review
description: In order to keep our recommendations up to date, we maintain a Buyer s Guide with a wide spectrum of models, and a lot of ...
transcript: today we re going to be taking a brief look at the cybex e3 m this is the third installment of what we re thinking of as mini reviews meant to give you a basic impression of models that we don t currently have time to cover with a full review for our channel the epriam is in a way not worth a full review anyway since other than the motor functions it is identical to the regular preamp and despite some misleading information out there there have really been no relevant mechanical changes made to the model since our review in 2019. what has changed since then however is the wider market and the pre-m s place in that market so before we discuss those nifty motor functions let s revisit the basic model for a moment to get a picture of the pre-amp as a whole the pre-amp is an urban oriented mid-sized four-wheel swivel wheel reversible seat model whose main selling points other than the snazzy piping are mainly its highly adjustable seat it s one handed one piece fold and it s relatively lightweight mechanically speaking the model is generally unremarkable in its price class with its strongest attribute being a pretty simple and solid central folding mechanism which was more exciting at the time of its launch as were at slightly larger than average front wheels when the mid-sized market was mainly dominated by style-oriented but structurally weak models since that time however the market has changed phasing out a lot of those less practical showy models in favor of a variety of models built both stronger than the pre-amp and with either the same sized or larger front wheels yet despite this the pre-m does stand out now as it always has in one distinct way it s criminally expensive with the basic model this is just impossible to justify in my opinion and always was really but with the eprem which costs even more it s harder to know right because it s electronic and motorized and those things cost money so let s jump into it then and have a look at those motor functions to see whether the epriam has earned its price tag for those of you who don t fully understand how the model works the motorized functions of the e-prem essentially claim to offer the following that the model takes less force to push over rough terrain or uphills and also takes less force to hold while descending hills due to its braking function now despite wide cries that this is all just a gimmick i do actually feel that these functions could prove quite useful to a very specific portion of the public this is a special needs model only it hasn t been advertised that way so before i explain where and for whom the stroller could be useful let s address the rest of you as far as powering over rough terrain is concerned i would remind you that the e-pream is only the regular preamp with a motor and the regular pre-amp is a city model if you drive it too often over rough terrain you will break it the world is not made of foam rubber and i m hoping that if any of you see anything even remotely like those hilly mats that they have next to the e prem display in every stroller store where it s sold you ll be smart enough to avoid those patches regularly using the motor to force your way over rough terrain like that is a death sentence especially for the model s front wheels and housings and cybex s guarantee is pretty bad too by the way designed to cover the minimum they can get away with as far as i read it understanding then that the motor does not turn the basic pre-amp into a dirt bike let s address going uphill here the motor will make pushing the model easier but please note that we re already talking about smooth pavement and a stroller that s pretty lightweight and maneuverable so how useful is this function then really to touch the subject delicately does the choice not to push a lightweight wheeled object up a smooth paved hill really fit with the fresh and fashionable lifestyle images that cybex uses to sell the model or would it actually be more accurate to view this as the stroller equivalent of the fast food drive-thru and then there s that last element the self-braking on downward slopes and here i have to admit there is some use value hills can be sketchy especially if there s some ice or snow on the ground but it better not be a lot of ice not late winter many times thawed and re-frozen ice and it better not be more than a drifting of snow because it s still just a midsize model with relatively low tolerance for such conditions in the end then even though this function is a tad useful if you live in these sort of conditions anyway then the e3 am won t give you a quarter of the capability you could get out of a decent three-wheeler with a dynamic handbrake and with these motor functions being only peripherally useful my honest hunch is that if you were to buy the e3m you wouldn t be using them much anyway the way i understand it the battery dies if you forget to turn it off after use just like your car battery if you don t fully close the door and it takes six hours to charge it up given those facts how many people with eprems are out there right now who don t use the motor functions 90 of the time on the other hand as i indicated earlier there is probably one group of people who never fail to charge the battery for whom the epm is actually really useful and that is people who have medical conditions such as arthritis or back problems perhaps have just undergone difficult c-sections or our elderly grandparents from a practical standpoint this stroller is not just something to stand next to in your instagram pictures it s for them even though i haven t seen it portrayed this way in any of cybex is advertising in any case we hope you found this video interesting if you d like to know more about this model or the basic preamp we recommend you watch our review of this basic model as well we d also like to ask you to subscribe as it helps us to continue making videos in the future in addition if you are currently shopping for a stroller we have a buyer s guide on our patreon page which lists a wide range of models that we recommend with a lot of technical and lifestyle related information you can find it by following the link in the description thank you

there s no cup holder or place for your phone overall if you re someone with a middle-of-the-road budget who s looking for an easy to operate and compact stroller you might love the city mini gt too as much as we did and if you re still doing research be sure to check out fabulous best stroller guides for more options happy registering Music

title: Baby Jogger City Mini GT2 Stroller Review
description: We purchased and reviewed the Baby Jogger City Mini GT2 stroller along with the top 20 lightweight ...
transcript: the Baby Jogger City Mini GT2 Bridges the gap between a full-sized full-featured everyday stroller and a lightweight stroller at 20b it s priced reasonably at around 400 that s a great price given that you can use it for infants with the included car seat adapter all the way up to Children 65 lb or 44 in tall we love the folding it takes just 1 second to fold and you can do it with one hand unfolding takes two seconds and it s possible with one hand but easier than with two if you want to stand it up for storage it s easy to take off the front wheel the storage basket is pretty big but you have to navigate under the bar going across the back or go through the side it does have a pocket on the back for smaller items there s a big peekaboo window that closes with a magnet it has a sturdy and comfortable rubber handle that s adjustable from 36 to 44 in high it was the only adjustable handle in the 20 lightweight strollers we compared the parking brake is on the handle compared to regular brake pedals this takes some time to get used to the harness straps are a little Annoying to adjust and they have to be rethreaded to raise the shoulder height it s a fairly easy rethread though the Buckle operation isn t as smooth as some strollers but not too bad the seat reclines and raises easily and goes back a decent amount there s a nice ventilation option why must I buy a cup holder separately we compared ride smoothness and the GT2 has one of the least bumpy rides in part that s because of the large Wheels with rubber Treads and three-wheel suspension it steers and Maneuvers easily on and off the sidewalk and we found that it performs better off-road than most other strollers it also stays on course on long straight walks but you can also lock the front wheel the GT2 is comfortable with thick seat padding and an extendable footrest it doesn t sit as upright as we would like the canopy offers pretty full Su protection although there are some strollers with canopies that go down farther you can buy a snack tray and cup holder separately the city mini GT2 has a sturdy frame and high quality materials like other strollers made by Baby Jogger in our sound testing the GT2 had one of the lowest average decible level readings we didn t find any pinch points that concern us the GT2 probably because of its wide rear wheelbase was less likely to tip over sideways than other strollers in our tip over test although the extra width is a problem getting through small doorways here s a quick list of what we like and don t like first easy folding smooth steering and better than average on bumpy terrain size for big kids and we don t like the bar across the back the less than upright seat and it s pretty big when folded if you like this please like And subscribe

transcript: here are the five most common questions we ve heard about the baby jogger city mini gt2 stroller number one is it really that easy to fold yep you really only need to use one hand to fold this stroller which matters most when your hands are full and trust me they ll pretty much always be full to be fair though i ve had a few years of stroller folding experience so i thought i d let my neighbors give it a try neighbors that have not folded a stroller in several years and even they were able to figure it out pretty quickly just keep in mind there are a few things to do before you fold one release the lock on the front swivel wheel otherwise it ll keep it from collapsing flat and two adjust the handlebar all the way up otherwise the stroller won t stand up on its own once folded question number two can it really handle all terrains let me show you we cruised sidewalks streets grass gravel wood chips and that was just getting to and from the playground you ll notice a slight difference between smooth sidewalks and more unpredictable terrain like grass of course but the built-in suspension helps it feel more like gliding than pushing the forever air tires are also small but mighty they re designed to never go flat and i d say the three wheel design also really helps with the maneuverability or at least it feels easier to pull off cool moves like this on to question number three how long can you use it the stroller seat is designed to be used once your baby can sit up on their own which could be around six months but the major perk about the gt2 is that there are adapters available for so many different infant car seats britax kiko peg perego kleck cybex great go maxi cosi and even baby jogger s own pram or infant car seat the gt2 actually comes with the city go 2 adapters already in the box question number four does it have a reversible seat no it does not the gt2 seat stays facing forward as in it s not modular if you purchase the pram or use the stroller as a travel system baby will face you but then after that they get to sit forward and face the world they ll also get to kick up their feet on the nice calf rest recline nearly flat and enjoy strolling beneath the shade of a massive canopy with lots of visibility i m totally jealous lastly question number five is it worth it it s totally up to you of course but for reference premium features like all-wheel suspension are usually reserved for strollers that cost nearly twice as much as the gt2 so while you might not get the leather detailing or extra large storage basket you will be getting a solid combination of features that you won t generally find in other strollers under 400 the list of car seat adapters and compatible accessories is impressive the variety of color options available just keeps growing and the handful of go-to features parents crave in an everyday stroller make this a promising choice whether you re a city or suburban family hope this helps Music

title: Bugaboo Fox 5 Modular Stroller IN-DEPTH Demo and Review!
description: The Bugaboo Fox 5 is an easy-to-use modular stroller packed with upgrades to make every parent s life easier! In this video, join ...
transcript: welcome to the baby cubby my name is Julie and today we are going to be reviewing the new Bugaboo Fox 5 modular all-terrain stroller but before we do make sure to like subscribe and comment down below with any questions you have about the stroller now let s get started the Bugaboo Fox 5 is the newest version of the classic Bugaboo Fox stroller this is an all-trend stroller with the ability to adapt easily to your needs the Bugaboo Fox 5 packs in some amazing new upgrades including one-handed adjustments for the fold handlebar foot rest extension canopy height and recline it also has improved maneuverability a higher seat Ambassador adjustment positions an improved position of the Comfort Wheels Ford accessory and was redesigned with a more premium look we love when Brands make improvements to their strollers and this truly makes for an easier experience for parents now let s go over some other features for the fox 5. when you receive the Fox 5 out of the box you will receive the frame and hardware for the seat and bassinet the seat Ambassador fabric bassinet bottom an aerated mattress the Swing Away bumper bar the sun canopy the wheels and wheel Hardware the included rain cover infant car seat adapters and the under seat basket when setting up the Fox 5 for the first time you will notice that the seat frame comes assembled with the bassinet Bugaboo did this so that your stroller is ready for baby as soon as they arrive this stroller also comes with click and go car seat adapters to create a travel system the Fox 5 s UPF 50 plus extra large extendable canopy is made with durable materials and provides ample ventilation for your little one this canopy is also machine washable along with all other Fabrics found on the fox 5. when it comes to the seat Bugaboo provides a unique frame design that allows you to transform the bassinet into a seat once baby outgrows the bassinet this allows for more compact storage because it minimizes stroller Parts while you save the bassinet for your next baby the ergonomic stroller seat features premium yet easy to care for soft brushed fabrics and a no refund harness complete with ultra soft shoulder pads it also has a three position recline and an easy to use Swing Away belly bar this seat is modular meaning it can face either direction or can be completely removed when using the included car seat adapters or to create a more compact folding option the Fox 5 s bassinet has a Sleek design with an aerated 3D comfort mattress mattress cover integrated parent pockets and an easy to zip apron there is even a breezy panel at the back of the bassinet for extra ventilation which helps baby regulate their body temperature but rest assured it has been tested at high wind speeds to ensure your baby stays cozy in any weather when the panel is in the closed position both the belly bar and push bar are wrapped in a leatherette detailing the push bar has multiple height positions and has integrated attachment points for the popular Bugaboo accessories there is also a convenient wrist strap for safer strolls one new feature we love is the height adjustment of the canopy and foot rest this is great for taller children who need a little more extra room when they grow and provides four additional inches total the Fox 5 s chassis is made with lightweight durable and sustainable materials and comes in both graphite and black this stroller comes in a variety of different fashion options to fit your style there is also a variety of amazing Bugaboo accessories that you can pair with this stroller one accessory we love in particular is the Comfort wheeled board this board creates a space for your older child making the Fox 5 able to easily transport up to two children at once the Fox 5 is equipped with Advanced all-wheel suspension this stroller s wheels are puncture proof the front swivel wheels are 8.5 inches in diameter and can be locked when encountering tougher tree the back wheels are 12 inches in diameter there is also a handy One Touch foot brake the Fox 5 s basket is equipped with extendable flaps a new hidden Pocket and has a capacity of 22 pounds to fit all your necessities and the basket is easily accessible from the front or back for additional storage pair the Fox 5 with one of bugaboo s diaper bags or the parent organizer as for the weight the Fox 5 weighs a total of 22.8 pounds and can be used from birth to 50 pounds now let s review the folding instructions note that the Fox 5 can be folded with the stroller seat in either direction or with the bassinet attached it can also stand on its own in the folded position thanks to the new and improved self-stand design first line up the seat or bassinet frame with the direction of The Handlebar Engage The One Touch brake and lower the push bar Engage The Safety Lock and middle adjustment button on the handlebar lower The Handlebar to the ground while pulling up on the seat or bassinet frame to complete the standing fold to unfold the stroller pull up on the belly bar until you can reach the handlebar and set the stroller to an upright position you will hear an audible click adjust the seat and handlebar to your desired position and you re ready to roll to create a more compact fold for tighter spaces you can take off your seat or bassinet and set it aside and fold the frame separately so you can soar both easier that wraps up our review on the amazing Bugaboo Fox 5 modular stroller we love this stroller for its ability to adapt to your needs for its Ultra smooth push and performance you can shop for the Fox5 at babycubby.com we offer price matching and free shipping on orders of 95 or more to learn more about Bugaboo check out this video thanks for watching and we ll see you next time foreign

title: Mountain Buggy Nano Stroller Review - Babylist
description: If you find yourself in need of a one-handed stroll, super compact, airplane friendly, suped up umbrella stroller, then you ll want ...
transcript: Music hey everyone Scout Julie here reviewing one of the most versatile strollers on the market the mountain buggy Nano if you find yourself in need of a really great one-handed stroll super compact airplane friendly what souped-up umbrella stroller then you ll want to listen up because you ll want to get to know the Nano I live in a city where climbing up and down subway stairs is part of everyday life and let me tell you this stroller makes carrying a toddler in one arm and a stroller and the other actually manageable the fold however is not so manageable with a toddler and it s the one major thing I wish were different about the stroller more on that later let me pick this off with the perks of this stroller it s really lightweight at only 13 pounds the Nano makes traveling with your stroller a lot easier the folded dimensions are 12 inches by 22 inches by 20 inches and comes with the shoulder strap making it convenient for toting around town plus it fits into the overhead compartment of an airplane so no need to gate check your stroller when flying it has an incredibly smooth one-handed steer has flip-flop friendly brakes and its infant car seat ready no need for adaptors with this baby it can convert into a travel system accommodating any infant car seat with these built-in belt style adaptors Mountain Buggy also is the option of a newborn cocoon carry cot that you can purchase separately the seat itself is suitable for your child from six months all the way up to 44 pounds it has a two paneled canopy with a flick out Sun Visor and a security strap for safe strolling and for closing the canopy it features a comfortable footrest for your toddler and adjustable leg rest which makes snapping in the stroller more comfortable it has a multi-position reclining seat although it doesn t go into a completely flat position it also has a five-point harness and comes with to harness pads but be aware the pads slip off really easily in fact on my very first time using it I lost a pad basically be aware of loose strap pads when you re taking your child in and out of the stroller it has a decent-sized storage compartment for a compact stroller also if you want a tray or a cup for you or your little one you have to purchase that separately the Nano features built in rear-wheel suspension which is pretty rare for a lightweight stroller so we can absorb light shocks and it s engineered with perfect weight distribution for optimize performance and smooth travel the front wheels swivel but can be locked straight for more difficult terrain it also includes a travel bag just pop the back wheels off and here s a tip I use the key to make it a little bit easier then you can store the back wheels right in the bag the cool thing is though you can roll it like a suitcase since the front wheels remain outside of the bag or you can use the back strap for over-the-shoulder carry here s what you might not love about the Nano it s not a one-handed folds in fact you use two hands and you almost have to use your whole body to fold it down you need to press the buttons on the side at the same time to fold the canopy behind the seat then grab the stroller on both sides fold that down then make sure it s clicked on the side and attach the canopy to the handlebar so that it doesn t flop open you can however open it with one hand and it s only two steps another thing you might not love is that and the canopy isn t open you can t see the handlebar so it s sort of rests on top of your hands as you can see last thing to consider is that the price is over 200 bucks for contacts here there are lightweight strollers on the market that are bare-bones and basic that run for about 20 bucks and there are other ones out there like this one that offer tons of features and luxuries that still keep that light weight factor a top priority that run around 250 I d say this is a lightweight stroller that you d purchase if you re looking for something that lasts and that will make your life easier along the way as you can see my 6 foot 4 husband can comfortably stroll with the Nano to quote him I love the stroller what does right want more info on great travel strollers head to baby let s calm and check out the best travel shoulders guide happy registering and traveling Music

title: UPPAbaby VISTA V2 Stroller Review - Babylist
description: Heads up, there s now a NEW version of UPPAbaby Vista V3! Check it out here ...
transcript: Music this is the upper baby vista v2 a full-size convertible stroller that can support up to three kiddos with a smooth ride and a slew of high-end details and accessories for around a thousand bucks you get all of this the stroller frame and wheels bassinet attachment bug shield bassinet storage bag the toddler seat attachment another bug shield and a rain shield too for reference that is a lot of included accessories so let s get into the stroller options you can stroll with one two or three babies of various ages and stages as a single you can start strolling from birth with the included bassinet or attach your own infant car seat with a separate car seat adapter unless you go with the uppababy mesa that connects without one then once baby can sit up on their own they can enjoy the toddler seat until they reach 50 pounds let s say you have two babies like twins congratulations by the way then you re in luck unlike other doubles say the mockingbird stroller the vista v2 can support two bassinets or two infant car seats at the same time you ll just need to purchase the extra bassinet now if you have two babies of different ages like i did you may be able to carry them both at once with what s right in the box at first but you ll likely end up buying a second seat or a rumble ride along with a set of adapters for when you have two toddlers and if you add a third to the bunch also like i did that s where the piggyback stroller board comes in having so many options can be cool but also a little confusing like you may not realize right away that there are different adapters for the upper and lower levels or that the second seat actually has a lower weight limit than the included toddler seat that being said uppa has an expansion tool on their website to help you visualize it all better while planning and once you ve found the configuration and accessories you like it s easy to get into the groove from day to day as for the stroller adjustments the toddler seat is modular so you can flip it forward or rear-facing and then you can recline it to whichever angle is most comfy for your little one just keep in mind that depending on how you line up the seats you may not be able to fully recline one of the seat as much as the other the ventilated and expandable canopies on both the bassinet and toddler seat have great visibility and airflow and on the toddler seat the canopy is height adjustable which is really helpful for taller kiddos like my lennox the storage basket is impressively large as in it can hold 20 more pounds of stuff than other comparable double strollers like the nuna demigrow and it s pretty easy to access despite the big bar going across the opening there s also a telescoping handlebar which is great for caretakers of varying heights and the stroll is really smooth and durable you can feel the premiumness here the shock shock-absorbing all-wheel suspension glides and turns with ease even as you add more kids and accessories pro tip for you parents with multiples put your heavier kiddo in the back seat parents have said it s really hard to steer with the weight mostly up front now having said that you do have the option to lock the front wheels for a little extra oomph as you manage the added weight or if you re riding on a rougher terrain speaking of weight like most double strollers the v2 is on the heavier side but you ll only need to worry about that for the few seconds that you re folding it down and loading it into the trunk otherwise you can just let it stand up on its own and once it s folded down with the toddler seat attached it s still relatively compact i ll wrap things up by saying the obvious this is a good looking stroller the real leather accents the great variety of color options it s almost hard to choose but what s cool is up a baby will send you four swatches of fabric for free to see which one you like the best before you buy they also offer a three year warranty and a travel safe program that covers damages if you register and gate check your stroller inside of the travel bag the looks are also functional the toddler seat has easy to adjust no re-thread harness straps and the bassinet has water-repellent aerated mattress that s so comfy you could even buy a separate stand and use it as a full-time newborn sleep space overall the uppababy vista v2 is a versatile beautiful workhorse an investment yeah worth it that s up to you i hope this helps Music you

title: UPPAbaby VISTA V2 Review Best Stroller Travel System
description: This is a review of the UPPAbaby VISTA V2 and it is arguably the best stroller and travel system for your baby or toddler s . In this ...
transcript: the upper baby vista is one of the most popular and highly rated strollers you ll find and new for 2020 is the vista v2 so let s go look at the stroller find out how it compares to older versions and i ll answer that question is it worth that 1000 price tag Music hey guys andrew here with dad virb and this video is brought to you by pish posh baby pish posh is your source for finding baby gear from brands including nuna bugaboo and more today we re diving into the uppababy vista v2 which you can find linked below let s start with the basic functions and then i ll get into my thoughts on this one main reason the vista attracts so many parents is its build quality and overall longevity this is a stroller meant to last you through multiple kids over the course of several years in fact before reviewing baby gear on this channel this was our very first stroller back in 2017 and we re still using it to this day it can expand to a double and accommodate two kids and with the addition of the piggyback accessory you can actually haul up to three kids which makes this extremely versatile now that note some of the biggest updates made for the v2 were largely centered around the seats the main toddler seat on the v2 is slightly larger with a higher 20 inch seat compared to the 19 incher from previous versions and it also has a deeper two and a half inch foot rest versus the two inches from the older gen they also introduced a non-rethread harness complete with straps that adjust a bit easier than before now one of the most notable changes has been the redesigned canopy and it is near perfect with older models the extended sunshade was tucked into the canopy which was convenient but it was also flimsy and it didn t offer that much more coverage with the v2 the canopy is made up of three panels most of the time the canopy will be extended to its standard two panel form but you can now unzip and expand that third panel and get that full coverage along with some extra airflow through a mesh window to expand the vista to a double you ll need to pick up the rumble c and adapters now what you re not seeing in this footage are the upper adapters which is just another thing to buy we didn t get that they do help with more legroom for the toddler seat but you can get away without it i will say you do need them if you are putting on the infant car seat though now that said it is important to note the differences between the toddler seat and the rumble seat which is smaller the toddler seat can accommodate kids up to 50 pounds whereas the rumble seat maxes out at only 35 pounds so if you have twins at some point when they get older one will sit a little bit more comfortably than the other now if you re not having twins this is ideal for two kids also i mentioned it before but the piggyback is a huge favorite of ours for us we most often go with the toddler seat and piggyback for our oldest as opposed to going with the double seats obviously the rumble seat and piggyback are extra accessories they don t come with the stroller but what does come included is the bassinet it s suitable for infants up to 20 pounds and it is rated sleep safe when used with their bassinet stand now from what i ve seen parents are split on whether or not they want to use the bassinet or just stick with the infant car seat the bassinet is great for maintaining that flat back positioning for spinal development and open airways while the infancy is super convenient with regards to moving the baby from the car to your stroller regardless of your preference it is nice that the bassinet is included though some may just set it aside unused on that note let s chat about car seats without the adapter the vista can take the uppababy mesa car seat which is what we mostly used for our first two kids it s great unless bundled it does come separate and it ll run you about 300 bucks now most parents i see will go in that direction for the mesa but if you re eyeing other options you can pick up their adapter which can accommodate the following infant car seats my favorite on this list being the nuna pipa lite lx that said i am partial to sticking with products under the same brand umbrella so i just recommend getting the mesa as it is the native option i want to note that i ve talked a bit about accessories adapters and whatnot it s annoying that these things cost so much extra but it is nice to know that upper baby has a large range of extras that you can pick up on their site also whatever works for the v2 will also work for the vista models from 2015 and up and as a quick plug buying the vista or any of its accessories through the link below helps support this channel and it s at no additional cost to you guys so if you do end up going with the vista please consider buying through there it is how i stay afloat and it s what keeps my camera rolling for you guys moving on let me briefly hit on the fold on either side of the frame are triggers which you ll need to pull to initiate the fold it is an easy motion and after having tested a bunch of strollers i have a big appreciation for how slim the fold actually is i love the footprint especially when comparing it to the mockingbird or the glue go complete it can fold with both seats on there but sometimes the open can stick a bit personally i just take the second seat off when getting it into the trunk also it can get pretty heavy if you don t the stroller and seat weighs roughly 27 pounds so it is on par with other full sizes in the category the frame itself is made of aluminum and magnesium having flown with the vista multiple times across the us i can attest that it can take hits and it can stand up to those ever so gentle airport baggage handlers but bonus tip if you use uppababy s travel bags for the mesa cruise or vista and register it on their site any damage will be fully covered under their travel safe program so it s a very cool thing that not too many people are talking about at the very top of the frame you ve got a nice leather covered telescoping handlebar which is great for parents of differing heights and moving all the way down the basket got a sleek remodel for the v2 it does remain large and can carry up to 30 pounds of cargo and it includes a storage pocket for smaller carry-along items like your phone and wallet it can be accessed from both the front and rear but one thing i do have to comment on is i ve never been a fan of that crossbar cutting the basket in half it creates an inconvenient divide which has always been an annoyance for larger bags and items now it s not actually an issue i m just annoying and i wish it was a little bit more open like mockingbirds or the nuno demi grows rounding it out let s take a look at the polyurethane wheels it s measuring at eleven and a half inches for the rear and eight inches at the front so same as last year but new for the v2 the tires are softer and the new spring action all-wheel suspension system has been redesigned for a smoother ride on all types of terrain i ll circle back to the feel of the stroller in a moment but just know that this thing glides also new for 2020 is a wheel lock indicator for the front wheels and to cap everything off or the brakes which haven t really changed from older generations it hasn t needed to it s great as is it s a single pedal break with a color indicator to tell you if the break is active so those are all the basic functions color wise you ve been looking at the emmett color style upper babies rolled out a bunch of new colors for 2020 they always seem to be rotating those they ve got great neutrals have a look you ll you ll definitely find something for you now the important part beyond the functions let s get into the buying decision if budget is of no concern i would honestly say get the vista for me it s easily one of the best overall daily drivers that you ll find and it is as close to a perfect stroller as you can get now for those on the fence should i get it should i not this part is for you if you re wondering if the added cost is worth it it is subjective but i would say yes now if you re really trying to stretch that budget and you know that spending over a thousand dollars for the vista and mesa that that s gonna hurt then stop watching don t worry about it google the even flow pivot expand or the mockingbird stroller and then just run with those you ll probably get more value out of the evenflo expand because it does come with that safe max infant car seat either way you re going to be happy with one of those they are a wonderful budget friendly options and you should not feel bad about missing out on something like the vista it s a sentiment that i hear often please don t feel that it s a stroller the other options that i mentioned are great that said the question i often get is why would i spend over a grand when i can just go with the even flow or mockingbird for half the price and be happy and i could point to a couple things to answer that but the main thing is it s all in the details that make the vista a technically more sound and just better option the push is like no other it s the smoothest stroller i ve pushed and it s simply better with terrain versatility suspension turns in single-handed operation the fold is slimmer and somehow has less bulk than the mockingbird despite having the same size the form factor is just more buttoned up here it s easier to get in and out of the back of your car and for whatever reason i pinch my fingers less the customer support warranty and travel safe program all ensure an already remarkably strong stroller and to dovetail that last note the thing that i see most often is that there are times when people have gone with the graco kiko or evenflo option and have come away unhappy for one reason or another they always say they ended up splurging for the vista and never looked back no pain of having to get something fixed or unhappy with the quality they wish they would have just gone with the vista in the first place and called it a day so you are guaranteed a quality starter the way that the pelicans saw zion in the draft i have to end on the basketball reference guys lebron jordan the upper vista kobe that s the league that we re in as i mentioned buying through the link below helps support this channel and it s at no additional cost to you if you found this video helpful please hit that like button down there it looks like a thumbs up for more videos and reviews for young families please consider subscribing to our youtube channel thanks for watching this video and come back for the next one god bless later

the cup holder is very important for me to have i like that it has large canopies on both the actual stroller and the car seat has like canopies that like go far over to block the sun i m really big on aesthetics and looks i like that it s black and dark gray i feel like that it s easy to clean so i like the color i like that it was affordable because baby some of these strollers are um you know six hundred to a thousand dollars and that wasn t in my budget so i like that it s affordable and i like that it was an easy setup like i mean easy like taking it out of the box and setting it up completely because i did it when i was pregnant and i did it by myself and it was easy so those are my pros ready for my cons not too many cons one of the cons is it s i mean when you have the toddler seat on it it s bulky like it takes up my entire space in my trunk and i mean i m sure car seats do i mean strollers do take up a lot of space in your trunk but this one is once you have the toddler seat it s really big and bulky it s lightweight i m sorry that was a pro i could have said it is lightweight but it s also bulky also i wish the snack tray for the adult was deeper so that i could put my phone in but it s just very like flat and it just has like a little bit so like if you put your phone in and hit a bump your phone could fall out and there s also no option for a double stroller i know that a lot of single strollers also have options to add on so that you can make it a double or so that you can have the toddler seat and the car seat go together this one does not so if you do have multiple children this is not the option for you because it s just a single stroller when we have more kids i m going to need to look into another stroller so that is something to consider but anyway overall i love this stroller i just recommend this stroller on all levels especially if you guys are just starting out and don t want to pay a ton for a stroller all right guys if you re still difference for me because I think having something that your baby can grow with all the way from the beginning especially if you re a new parent and you re not thinking about all the possible things going on I think this is such a great option to have I will say in the beginning I was really nervous about my baby sleeping in the car seat on long walks or just always being in the car seat I think the Graco modes Nest this one is a two-handed fold you just press the side buttons and lift up and then push down the stroller ends up standing on its own which we love and I know this looks big but about this one is it does complete the fold itself so as you can see it stands and it locks in place it s another a large one but definitely feels light when you fold it do you have one that you prefer yes the Graco Perma is by far the most compact and in my car I prefer a smaller stroller so definitely would go with the prayer mat it s also super easy just to do with one hand yeah I like the one hand but I also like how easy the nest to grow is to go down I know it s a heavier stroller it s about 30 pounds but I love the handles there and you just go down it goes really easy for a stroller being that heavy definitely something I forgot to think about when I was purchasing my stroller is how often you re going to unfold it let s go ahead and start with this unfold you re going to unlock on the side and then you need to do a little pop and then with the nest you re gonna unlock and then do a little pop-up action just like that and last but not least we have the Graco premette similar situation you re gonna unlock voila and if weight is a little bit of an issue for you I have to say that the pramet was definitely the easiest to unfold I d agree I think the permit is definitely the easiest to unfold so as for the best stroll I would have to say that I enjoyed pushing around the Prem at the most I thought it was light I thought it was easy to maneuver yeah super easy to maneuver so like if weight is an issue for you I really think that the pramed is a very good stroller as far as this one even though was a little harder to maneuver it is the heaviest and the babyless experts did say that this one has the best suspension which we agree with this one has the least bounce for baby it s because these tires are almost like jogging tires which is the only one out of these three that has tires that are that big all right and finally let s talk about what makes these strollers unique let s talk about the features and the primet that is 220 The Nest that is 320 and the nest to grow that is about three ninety dollars so all three of these toddler seats are reversible so you just click them in and then this one as well reverses case you want baby to face you and they also all three recline so these two actually have this nice little lever which offers a few more reclining options versus the primet has the strap that you can pull down so you can basically recline it halfway and then all the way but that s about it and then these two also still have the pram option where the baby lies all the way flat and they re super easy to put back facing forward just by popping it out putting it right back in very easy just like that another great feature that these two have is the slide to me feature so you are able to slide baby down further away or closer up the nice part about this feature is it even works when the toddler seat is reversed and there s three height options you can go all the way up like I am right now the middle and it clicks right into place or all the way down and speaking of things that are adjustable this one actually has an adjustable handlebar so you just press the buttons on the sides and that way if you re a little shorter or if you are taller and need the handlebar higher you can adjust that to your liking all right Kayla now let s talk about our favorite thing the basket yeah that s right all of these have a ones have cup holders that are already on the stroller you have to buy those separately but the premette has a cell phone holder they go above and beyond let s go and another nice feature is that not only parents can have their drinks but the kiddos can have their drinks as well and with all that being said which one of these strollers is right for you the primed is cost effective you can stroll from birth and if you re a smaller person this is a really good stroller for you because it is lightweight and easy to fold and if you re looking for a stroller with higher end features that is still title: Baby Jogger City Tour 2 Stroller Review Love Baby Jogger!
description: We purchased and reviewed the Baby Jogger City Tour 2 stroller along with the top 20 lightweight ...
transcript: we purchased the Baby Jogger City Tour 2 stroller and put it through a series of over 100 standardized tests and measurements to help you decide if it s the best fit for your family the Baby Jogger isn t a jogging stroller it s the lightest upscale stroller in the Baby Jogger lineup and it s a popular choice because of its lightweight design and especially for City Drillers and frequent Travelers and it s competitively priced we scored the strollers in these categories starting with weight and folded size the city tour 2 is a very lightweight 14 pounds its folded size is just 2.2 cubic feet it s a compact package that s convenient for storage and transportation it s worth noting that while it is small it s slightly larger than the typical airline overhead bin size requirements so do check that before traveling it scored very well in this category next parent ease of use the storage basket is small compared to some strollers but we still got a big diaper bag into it and a backpack unfortunately there are no cup holders or other storage pockets we love the grip on the rubber handle it s 38 and a half inches high similar to most other strollers but maybe low if you re tall the handle is a little loose at the fold joint there s a peekaboo window so you can keep an eye on things but we found the velcro on it to be a bit noisy the Buckle isn t bad the shoulder and hip Clips Stay Together pretty well the shoulder straps have to be re-threaded but honestly you may not need to use them except for younger kids the sea recline mechanism takes one hand to lower and two hands to raise we love how easy the brake is to use and how it feels but you have to get it all the way pressed down or it will release itself the final score needs of use next kit comfort the seat is pretty upright at 64 degrees but it is short at 16 and a half inches compared to the Bugaboo butterfly for example this stroller isn t sized for taller kids we do like the leg rest and the seat has a decent recline angle while the seat padding isn t the thickest or the thinnest it does provide some comfort but the plastic board can be felt through the padding also the sun canopy stops short of where the knees Bend and doesn t provide as much coverage as some strollers do it had an average score in ride smoothness and not the best overall kit Comfort score but now on to folding the folding is designed well and can be done with one hand however sometimes it requires some shaking it takes us an average of four seconds to fold and five seconds to unfold the part that is latched stays folded well but the other third often opens when it shouldn t it fits nicely in small spaces on a positive note it does come with a travel bag with a padded strap not terrible but not great in folding but it gets better steering maneuverability is where the city tour really shines it steers and turns responsibly on smooth surfaces and on grass rough terrain of any kind is not recommended front wheel locks keep it going straight if you aren t going to be turning much but it doesn t Veer much anyway and it s great at jumping curbs overall a great score of maneuverability what about quality well the city tour 2 is made from high quality parts and fabric as far as I can tell although the wheels could be better constructed it was average in our sideways tip over testing and tipped over backward when we hung a 12 pound bag on the handlebar we found a few potential pinch points near the hinges it s one of the quietest strollers we ve tested all in all a nice quality score the baby Jagger City Tour 2 ended up with an overall score of 70. putting it in eighth place out of the 20 strollers we ve tested here like this please like And subscribe

reviewing a lot of travel strollers some things that kind of stand out to me as far as features go but it served me well it was compact it was lightweight and I really liked how upright the seat was and some of those features that really worked for me there were also some downsides the biggest downside and why I actually sold it and ended up starting the stroller mom as a result is because it wasn t compatible with my car seat and when I was traveling I needed my car seat to be able to come with me and so that s ultimately why I ended up moving away from this stroller which led me to the world of travel strollers and why I have the stroller mom today so this stroller retails for 260 so it is expensive it s a lot more than I paid in 2021 and there s some things that feel a little outdated on it the handlebar overall is comfortable I love baby joggers handlebar just in general that like more rubbery feel however it s short it s definitely not the tallest you re not going to kick the wheels necessarily but it just feels like a lower it s not adjustable the canopy does not touch your hands which is good but there is no extension here you just have this this is it which is okay I honestly was okay with it when I had a toddler but with my baby I ve already noticed the sun being in her eyes this is the thing that is just I don t know it I have not reviewed a stroller with a velcro peekaboo window in a long time that wakes up your baby if they re sleeping and it is a big downside it kind of honestly feels a little outdated but I do like that it stays open when you can use the clasp there they technically you can unzipper this back part to add air flow but there s no place to store it or keep it up which I think is a little bit of a loss in regards to the seatback it is very upright it s one of the most uprights and it s pretty average it s not a tall seatback it s not a short seatback it s average it s not no rethread the buckles are okay but if I had one this is a new one I obviously bought for this review but the one I had before these wouldn t stay together this one actually does so I don t know if it was just effective or what the thing I love is how upate the seat is and that it s almost a completely full flat recline I also love that it has this foot rest and I was always very impressed with it because look at how large it is it s rounded so some parents have complained about that but I was really happy with that on naps on the go and then you do have a lower foot support here for your toddlers which I really liked as well to pull it up you re going to push these two buttons and just pull it up and it goes right to that upright position overall the stroller is really sturdy and I like that it only weighs 14.3 lb so it s definitely a lightweight option especially compared to the full size stroller I had at the time the basket can hold 15 lbs and it s honestly pretty spacious so this is not the biggest bag in the world but it fits really easily yesterday we were at a splash pad I had a giant pool bag shoved in here with pillow or with towels not pillows with towels and other things and it did really well I mean it doesn t look big but I ve honestly had very little complaints in regards to accessing the basket the brake is not the best it is not flipflop friendly it kind of hurt your foot when you do it but it s could be worse I can do it with sandals it s just not my favorite sometimes it sticks a little bit and you have to really push it down and then in regards to the wheels this my husband didn t like the stroller for this reason I it didn t always drive me crazy but it is annoying especially now that I ve tested other strollers the front wheels lock a lot I don t know if it s the closing mechanism or what the number of times that I had one wheel locked and so I m trying to like maneuver where I m going and you then have to come over here and open it it s just very annoying the other thing is is sometimes the wheels click a little bit the other biggest downside is the fold so while the fold is compact it fits in a lot of overhead bins to fold it you have this mechanism here which is fine you then have to push it over and then pull here but it doesn t always latch wow it latched that time but the number of times it doesn t latch and you have to like Pull It in together is a lot the other thing is is The Handlebar doesn t latch so if you pull the handlebar out sometimes it does that and then you have to kind of like play with it and then sometimes the front wheels don t go so actually it s gone pretty well this time I will say sometimes it does a good job but the fold was just very inconvenient the last few features I want to highlight for this stroller is the seat does hold 45 lbs and with its near flat recline it is compatible for younger babies it is also compatible with grco and Baby Jogger car seats but that s it that s where I ran into an issue the other thing that is really nice is they do sell a bumper bar and sometimes you can get the bundle on the bumper bar which is really nice and something I wish I had on this stroller but it is an additional cost so here are my final thoughts on the Baby Jogger City Tour 2 I like a lot of Baby Jogger products but this is probably not my favorite travel stroller I still think it s good for some families especially if you have a Baby Jogger or gray Co car seat I think the near flat recline and upright seat point plus a nice adjustable foot rest are huge selling points for parents and you can almost Overlook some of the other downsides there but I wish there were things like the velcro and the peek-aboo window and stuff was updated so I hope this video was helpful in deciding if this is the right stroller for you I do have a full lineup of my top budget friendly travel stroller so be sure to check that out and let me know if you have any questions below thank thanks for watching

maneuverability and all-weather seats the demi grow is getting a cool upgrade in 2022 for more versatility and comfort across seasons the demi grow now includes two interchangeable canopies the 949.95 50 more than previous models no changes have been made to the demi grows weight dimensions or weight capacity for one or two children the demi-grow seats each hold up to 50 pounds although the demigrow weighs around 30 pounds it is easy to steer or store thanks to a smaller footprint than many convertible strollers switch between the classic and air protect canopies depending on how much coverage you ll need the classic canopy provides full water repellent coverage with a peekaboo window and dream drape canopy extension for added sun protection the air protect canopy shields your baby from mosquitoes and sun while mesh side panels allow more airflow on hot days the built-in bug cover is stored in a zippered pocket at the front for easy access a no rethread harness with magnetic buckle adjustable calf support and removable winter seat liner with mesh backing ensure your child s comfort large puncture proof tires and adjustable suspension ensure a smooth ride wherever you go at the rear wheels flip the silver tab up for rough terrain or down for smooth surfaces to customize your ride with 23 configurations combining the toddler seats bassinets and infant car seats the demi grow can support your family whether you have one child children of different ages or twins for one child start with an infant car seat or overnight approved fasten up for a newborn then the reversible reclining toddler seat as your child grows for children of different ages you can attach an infant car seat or bassinet in a toddler seat at the same time and for twins you can attach two infant car seats bassinets or toddler seats as a single stroller you have lots of storage space in the included basket some of that storage space is lost once converted to a double stroller because the second seat attaches over the rear wheels however the stacked design for two makes the demi-growth smaller and easier to maneuver than a tandem double stroller by reducing weight over the front wheels and without losing a 50 pound weight capacity per seat to fold lower the demi grow handlebar then lift up on the tabs at either side of the frame while lowering the handlebar towards your feet the frame locks automatically at the side and stands when folded to carry lift with the padded leather at handle to unfold hinge the frame lock outwards and lift up on the handle the demi-grow is compatible exclusively with the nuna pipa series infant car seats attach your car seats the demi-grow using the included ring adapter with the option to attach a second car seat for twins with a set of post adapters to use the ring adapter set your car seat over top and it locks into place press the great button at the back of the canopy and lift up to remove to use the post adapters click the left and right sides of your nuna pipa into the posts and to remove press the grey buttons near the carry handle the demi grow is available in caviar black and hazel wood tan that s it for our review of the nuna demi grow convertible stroller if you need help finding the stroller that s right for your family email us at customercarestrollaria.com or leave a comment below thanks for watching Music Music you

title: The Nuna Demi Grow is GREAT but with a few drawbacks.
transcript: this is the Nuna demig grow and it works great as a single stroller I get soft fabric seats with harnesses I get handlebars adjustable leg rests I have storage space all underneath here if I push these buttons I can adjust my handlebars and to lock the stroller I just do this if baby wants to recline done if baby wants built- in suspension done and if baby wants to look at their handsome father done and it s easy to fold I push these two buttons pull back the triggers Fold It Forward lock it in place and that s it because it s the demig grow it grows with your family but in kind of an odd way now it s a double and if I need to put an infant c seat on the bottom I can baby b is pretty low so you get these covers over your wheels to make sure nothing splashes up on baby and these plastic pieces prevent things from going through the wheels the best part about this setup is that is super compact so it s easier to store and easy to maneuver but there s obvious drawbacks baby b gets a great view of the booty you only get storage Pace if you have the infant seat if you have the sibling seat it s all gone and the bottom baby can only face forward but if that works for you then it s great

title: Nuna DEMI Grow Stroller The Baby Cubby
description: We love the Nuna DEMI Grow because there isn t a feature this amazing stroller is missing! Not only does it grow from a single ...
transcript: Applause welcome back to the baby cubby today we re going to be talking about the nuna demigrow it is a single to double stroller it has 23 different modes and it can hold children up to 50 pounds straight out of the box you re gonna get the stroller frame the main seat car seat adapters a ring adapter fenders and a rain cover it comes in four color options caviar aspen frost and oxford it has an adjustable handlebar and belly bar each made of a luxe leatherette material to adjust the belly bar push the buttons on the outside edges of it and it will move up or down to detach it from one side press one of the gray buttons on the inside edge it has a upf 50 plus canopy with a mesh peekaboo window and a flip out eye shade it also has a zip out dream drape for extra coverage the seat has a one-handed recline using the lever on the back of it and one-handed adjustable calf support with a simple button on the front it also includes the five-point harness one of the coolest features is that it is an all-season seat meaning you can zip off the fabric lining to expose the mesh base for warmer days it has a large storage basket to fit diaper bags groceries or other items it has custom dual suspension depending on your terrain which is adjustable on the back of the frame the tires are foam filled and the front tires are lockable it has a tap on lift up foot brake behind the back right wheel the nuna demi grow comes with one seat that being said it comes with two car seat adapters so you can use both of them at the same time right out of the box for any other accessories like the second seat it s sold separately there is a lower attachment that will fit an identical seat to make it a double stroller it rests inside the basket and can recline as well you can also purchase a bassinet for your newborn or just use the included adapters to attach a nuna infant car seat like the pippa here are some of the possible modes with the demi grow you can use most accessories in either position one of the concerns that i hear from parents is that in double mode you lose your basket when in reality this is not completely true you do lose a portion of your basket obviously but there s still plenty of room to put a diaper bag and some extra things that you might need now we re going to show you how to fold the demi grail to start off remove the second seat if you have one attached and make sure the front wheels are unlocked lock the stroller and then pull up on the triggers on either side of the handlebar to engage the fold fold it until the auto lock clicks and the demi growth will stand up on its own to unfold it simply undo the lock on the side of the frame and pull up the handlebar until it locks overall we absolutely love the demi grow because of the unique features that it has one being that it has a very small footprint it is one of the smallest double strollers that you can find also because the seats are stacked on top of each other it centers the weight of the stroller and makes it easier on you to push thanks for watching if you want to shop the demi girl or any other strollers go to babycubby.com we offer free shipping on orders of over 25 if you d like to watch another video on one of our favorite strollers go ahead and click here don t forget to like and subscribe and we ll see you next time

title: Nuna Demi Grow Double Stroller 2018 Review NEW STROLLER

Not only did they give us a double stroller but it s a double modular which we love. So in this video we re going to show you the ins and outs and how this stroller can grow with your family.
