transcript: this is a GB pocket plus and today we re going to show you how to fold and unfold the stroller so looking at it from this angle there is this little hook here you need to pop that up on one side to unlock it then you can pull out both sides like this push in both of these buttons and pull up the top part now on a lot of like when the stroller gets a bit older you can probably just shake it out I ve seen a lot of demonstrations that show it this way but what s essentially happening is that you need to separate this front part from this back part so if you have a new stroller and it s difficult just hold one finger here and push with your thumb out until you manage to pull it out you can then lock it into place in that position and then you just need to unfold the back wheels which is just a matter of pulling them out like this now the stroller is unfolded and ready for use in order to refold the stroller you have to reverse the process which gets a little bit tricky with the back wheels so making sure that the front wheels are locked here s the lock mechanism that s actually quite important otherwise they kind of get in the way of the fold so front wheels need to be locked canopy needs to be back you then want to lift up the stroller a bit and click in this button here in order to fold up the back wheels and then while standing and holding up on the shopping basket with one foot for leverage depress the two white buttons on the handle slide it in and the whole thing will leap down again like this and you can flip it upside down and fold in the sides and reattach that initial hook so that it s locked into this nice little square rectangle shape in any case so that s how you unfold and fold the G B pocket plus we hope that you found this video useful and if you did we asked you subscribe as it helps us continue making videos in the future thank you

are pretty much the same with both the all-city is a little wider than the all-terrain but for the most part they re almost exactly the same size uh what people buy them for obviously is not their unfolded dimensions but they re folded dimensions which we will now demonstrate so one thing you don t see in all the demonstrations where they show you how fast it opens and closes is there s two things that you have to do before you can even fold it up the first thing is you need to fold the back legs in and you also need to lock the front wheels so unless you ve been driving around in up you push your two buttons you have to push down this is where i use my foot to kind of hold it and as i push down it then folds up you have to make sure that the legs don t come undone as you go course with the all all city it s a much simpler design it doesn t have the stabilization bars on the back it s a lot more stable it doesn t wiggle as much um the front wheels you don t have to lock them you can fold it exactly like it is and there s no legs in the back to fold up there s a downside to this of course which you ll see in a moment so the fold up is a lot simpler no the leg rest does need to be folded there s a good thing about this one it s got the kickstands it s got two plastic pieces here so that it can stand up very easily on its own it doesn t fall back down as you can see the downside to being a simpler fold is it s five inches taller it is an inch and a half narrower they re both about eight inches thick um with the canopies if you go with just the regular pocket plus they re a lot thinner because the canopy is just a single flap that folds over but as you can see um the instability in the in the chair itself you make up for it with the size it s also about a pound and a half two pounds lighter and of course the pocket plus is about three pounds lighter than this one so you actually make a big difference there when you re traveling obviously the biggest thing is do you need space do you need something that s going to be very compact that you can fit into an overhead compartment on air on an airplane or do you need something that s going to be much more functional larger basket more room for the child a more stable easier fold and unfold um then you re going to be going with the all city versus the all terrain or one of the other pocket pluses now for the unfold we ll start with the uh the all-terrain first it s definitely not the easiest unfold um in the videos they make it seem so simple but it s kind of spring loaded into place here so you almost need to hold the back side as you force the front side out then once it s out now you have to unfold your legs now you can either hit the switch or you can just force them out because they title: Uppababy Minu V2, An Impartial Review Mechanics, Comfort, Use
description: In order to keep our recommendations up to date, we maintain a Buyer s Guide with a wide spectrum of models, and a lot of ...
transcript: today we re finally going to do a proper review of the uppababy menu V2 that s taken all the way till now to get to Norway despite being launched last year we ve been looking forward to this one for quite a while as the menu has long been one of our favorite Ultra compacts and even though the changes accompanying the V2 update are pretty minimal it s still high time to have another in-depth look at the model so in any case I m gonna just jump right into it then going over the menu V2 from top to bottom and examining its advantages and disadvantages in terms of child Comfort ease of use performance and mechanics before ending with a discussion of which uses and environments it will best suit and starting off with some stats the menu V2 clocks in at 7.6 kilos and folds down to 32 by 52 by 58 centimeters with the bumper bar attached it can take the standard 22 and a half kilos in the seat and a full 9 kilos in the under slung shopping basket when it comes to child Comfort the menu V2 seat has a decent upright position and a reclined position that though not fully flat is still sufficient for napping the dimensions of the model seat are quite large overall with a generous width of 34 centimeters and a maximum length of 123. determined by adding up the lengths of the backboard baseboard space beneath the canopy and the distance between the seat and foot rest in practice this means that the menu V2 will remain usable all the way up until three and a half or four years old though I would note that the newly added adjustable leg rest while a nice addition is only 13 centimeters and is unlikely to provide leg support for younger toddlers in the reclined position past two years old or so as far as other aspects of the seed are concerned the menu V2 has somewhat softer textiles than the older version and the canopy has been upgraded with the standard extra portion zipped into the back which is a more pleasant way of expanding the canopy in my opinion and slightly improves what was already pretty adequate Sun coverage moving on to parent Comfort the menu V2 has a fixed handle height of 104 centimeters and a larger and more accessible shopping basket than what one finds on most Ultra compacts folding the model is easy can be accomplished with one hand and the process feels quite sturdy in terms of the mechanisms which is nice and something that can definitely not be said of all strollers of this size when folded down the menu V2 is pretty bulky versus other Ultra compacts and though it has both a handle and a shoulder strap it s not the sort of stroller that you ll want to have to carry around for long periods slung from your shoulder the folded dimensions of the menu V2 are unfortunately not within the iata s guidelines for cabin luggage and my experience talking with parents is that a lot of airlines won t let you take it on the plane but it does fall down to within widely accepted standards for gate checking and it s also of a very convenient size for packing in the trunk or other situations where you might appreciate a small folding stroller as far as driving is concerned the menu V2 has a sturdy rigid feel not loose side to side and also has both well above average suspension for a model of this size and larger than average rear wheels that further contribute to shock absorption as well as easier curb popping the menu V2 is of course not built for any real off-roading but can handle gravel dirt roads broken sidewalks and so on without either feeling too jittery thanks to that shock absorption as well as without risk of loosening up too much as a result of wear if you need to Traverse such conditions as an everyday thing all right let s move on to the mechanics of the model then beginning with the folding system and the overall structure of the chassis where the menu V2 uses a similar setup to up a baby s larger models the cruise and Vista V2 built simply and involving predominantly metal internal components most importantly thick cleverly angled rectangular steel pins within the folding locks themselves which are protected by reinforced housings from loosening up and wearing down as a result of steering pressure and the larger structural design of the chassis is equally impressive where the menu V2 in my opinion probably has the sturdiest skeleton of any Ultra compact on the market with strong reinforced hinges and connection points and a ton of support bars both vertically in the way the handle arms connect with the bars running down to the front frame above the Locking point of the fold and also horizontally with support from the front frame a welded rear crossbar a central crossbar a sturdy set of support struts involved with the seat and the handle itself moving down to the rear frame the mini V2 again has quite nice and noticeable suspension do both to the way it s angled as well as a proper degree of tension in the springs the model s brake system however is not my favorite sort of setup involving two pedals and being wire based without an adjustment screw for mitigating wear over time and this sort of system does occasionally run into problems down the line in particular if it s not lubricated regularly that being said upper baby models pretty much always have complicated wire-based systems and the minuv2s is at least disassemblable and up a baby is pretty good about providing spare parts for their models should you eventually need to swap out the wire for example when it comes to the wheels the rear wheels are again built a little larger than on most Ultra compacts and the tires are made of strong rubber that tends not to wear down too quickly the wheels sit a tad looser than I d like within the housings but using the original menu as a test case I haven t really seen or heard of any problems occurring from this over time looking lastly at the front frame the wheel size is again decent and there s a bit of suspension built into the forks not to the degree that you ll notice it as much as the rear suspension but still enough to help with a bit of extra shock absorption the menu V2 doesn t have swivel locks though this is okay in my opinion as despite being capable of dealing with some of the lighter rough situations found in urban environments is still not the sort of stroller you should be taking too much off-road the connection of the front forks within their housings is protected against horizontal pressure by using two separate circumferences with the axle in terms of both the axle itself and this raised plastic lip at the bottom which distributes the stress of steering or bumpy terrain such that the axle doesn t tend to widen out the channel to the point of causing wobbling problems so should you get the menu V2 then yes absolutely despite being a bit large for cabin luggage and my having a few nitpicks with some of the peripheral elements of its design such as the brake system the menu V2 is an awesome stroller and fills a niche need for parents whose lifestyle May Point towards an ultra compact as a good choice for storage reasons for example or living in a city that has narrower than average doorways or lots of small shops but who also needs something that can hold up to regular all-day use in rougher Urban environments that may have broken sidewalks dirt paths or lighter cobblestones it also makes for a solid choice for keeping in the trunk and pairing with a car seat and it s also one of those models whose base design has been around for many years now and has proven itself to hold up quite well over time in any case we hope you found this video interesting and if you did please subscribe as this sort of support really helps us to continue making videos in the future in addition if you re currently shopping for a stroller we have a buyer s guide on our patreon page which lists a wide range of models that we recommend with a lot of Technical and lifestyle related information you can find it by following the link in the description thank you

out visor and a mesh peekaboo window in the back the seat has a removable belly bar to make getting your child in and out easier the seat is probably the coolest part it s modular so it can face backward or forward and it reclines for comfort to convert the seat into a bassinet for newborns begin by removing the seat to face backward next undo the buckle on the back of the backrest to release the fabric recline the seat using the black lever lastly undo the two buckles below the footrest area to release the rest of the bassinet fabric if you want to utilize the travel system feature simply attach the included adapters and the mico 30 will rest easily into them the xelia has an extra large storage basket with easy access for storing diaper bags or other necessities the footbrick engages by pushing down and releases by flipping it back up lastly this stroller has rear wheel suspension and lockable swivel wheels in the front the wheels have a white stripe for added style to fold the zealia start by locking the footbrake make sure the seat unit is facing forward and then pull the trigger on the recline handle to fold it forward then pull the triggers on the side of the frame to fold the handlebar forward as well from here pull up on the black bar near the base of the frame and the whole thing will collapse make sure the frame locks it will stand up on its own when folded to unfold the zealia release the manual lock on the side of the frame and then pull up on the handlebar until the wheels separate and everything locks back into place adjust the seat as needed overall we love the maxi cozy zelia because of how lightweight and easy to maneuver it is and with the convenience of a travel system this makes it a really great single stroller thanks for watching you can shop title: Zelia Max 5-in-1 Modular Travel System from Maxi-Cosi
description: Today TTPM is reviewing the Zelia Max 5-in-1 Modular Travel System from Maxi-Cosi. It comes with a Mico Max 30 infant car seat ...
transcript: no matter how your baby wants to ride you ve got options with this hi I m Laurie from ttpm here with maxi cozies Zelia max 5 and 1 modular travel system this includes a stroller and infant car seat with base and if you want to see reviews of other stroller travel systems click Subscribe below what s cool about this stroller system is that the car seat attaches to the stroller frame for easy in Sandoz with baby but the stroller seat can be used as a fully reclined carriage for sleeping babies and then converted into a stroller seat for older children let s take a look at the car seat it s amico max 30 and it can be used rear-facing with babies from 4 to 30 pounds an infant insert is included for babies who weigh 4 to 5 pounds install it with or without the base although using the base makes it really easy to remove the car seat and attach to the stroller for quick ins and outs installing what the base also means you can use the latch connectors I love the design of these connectors but they re connected to one strap which can make tightening more difficult if you don t use the base you ll need to install the car seat using your vehicle s seat belts you can adjust the harness straps and the position of the buckle to accommodate baby as he grows although both of these tasks are a little tricky to do something else that was tricky was tightening the harness straps it felt like something was getting caught and preventing them from fully tightening a canopy on the car seat provides sun protection and it also has air protect side impact protection and an anti rebound bar on the base for extra stability the car seat seat pad can be removed for cleaning if you remove the car seat from the base that you can attach it to the stroller frame using the included car seat adapters or use the stroller seat in one of two ways as a fully reclined carriage it can be attached to the stroller and parent facing or outward facing modes and as baby gets older convert it to the stroller seat I thought the instructions for doing this were confusing and no need a lot of strength to buckle a strap underneath the seat as a stroller seat use this in parent facing or outward facing modes you can also adjust the height of the shoulder straps to one of three positions as baby grows and as a stroller seat there are three recline positions for your child s comfort in both carriage and seat mode there s an extendable canopy with flip-out visor for sun protection and a mesh peekaboo window so parents can keep an eye on baby attaching the canopy to the stroller was tricky for us a large basket underneath the seat gives parents plenty of space for bringing along essentials plus a parent cup holder fits on the side of the stroller stylish parents will also like the vegan leather trim on the handlebar which can be adjusted to three Heights to lock the stroller press down on the rear wheel peddle lift up on the pedal to release the brake there are four wheels on this stroller on the front two are swivel wheels that can be locked the stroller can be folded with the seat attached just make sure you first fold the seat which I had some trouble with then there are two steps to take for folding and you ll need both hands pull up on the handlebar releases and fold the handlebar then pull up on the frame fold handle and lift up to fold the frame there s a latch to keep the stroller locked when folded which we had a little trouble connecting and this stroller will stand on its own with the handlebar on the ground some parents might not think that sanitary but we ve seen it on other strollers before and you ll presumably have wipes with you anyway so because of the infant car seat you can use this stroller with babies from birth to 50 pounds and the car seat makes this travel system complete travel systems make it so easy to get baby out of the car and into the stroller and I like travel systems that come with a car seat and stroller together what s nice about this one is that it s got five modes and you don t have to buy anything extra to make all the modes work I found this stroller easy to maneuver but there were a few things that I wish had been different before I get into the pros and cons let me know in the comments what you like about this stroller and what s most important to you in a stroller my pros are the five modes the ease of steering and the car seat and stroller together the cons are the latch connectors on one strap difficulty tightening the car seat harness straps trouble with canopy assembly confusing instructions for going between carriage and seat and the fold not being easy so overall I give this stroller three and a half stars for where to buying current prices visit ttpm and subscribe to our YouTube channels for more reviews every day

title: 2022 Baby Jogger City Select 2 Stroller Review
description: Shop the Baby Jogger City Select 2 stroller here Questions about ...
transcript: Music hi i m sarah from strolleria in this video we ll review the baby joggers city select 2 available now at strollerria.com if you have questions email us at customercare at strollaria.com or leave a comment below with the city select 2 baby jogger is combining two models the city select and city select lux into one versatile stroller that grows with your family like previous models the stroller converts from single to double offering two dozen configurations and more space between seats than other double strollers functionally the city select two is similar to the city select but it adds new features like an updated design with leatherette details and it s up to 5 pounds lighter than older models the city select 2 is now available at strollerria.com let s take a look at the stroller the city select 2 has two price points the base model priced at 4.99 and the eco collection which costs 5.99 the two versions are the same in functionality but the eco collection offers a leatherette handlebar as well as upgraded fabrics and included bumper bar the city select 2 weighs just under 27 pounds making it 3 to 5 pounds lighter than previous models the eco collection version of the stroller has a more sophisticated look thanks to upgraded fabrics and a leather at handlebar and bumper bar the fabrics are made with tencel a material that s environmentally friendly as well as soft anti-bacterial and breathable the base model includes polyester and nylon fabrics in a plastic handlebar and the bumper bar is sold separately the eco collection stroller comes in four colors mulberry burgundy lunar black frosted ivory and harbor gray the base model city select 2 comes in three colors radiant slate peacoat blue and flint sage the city select 2 offers two dozen configurations for a single child siblings or twins you can use the stroller for a newborn by attaching a car seat or a bassinet sold separately you can change the position of the seat recline handlebar and footrest in a unique feature you can also slide the canopy higher to make room for a taller toddler when your family grows add the second seat kit consisting of the seats and adapters to turn the stroller into a devil the city select two uses two identical seats each with a 45 pound capacity that means you can move a seat from top to bottom by attaching the second seat adapters and then adding a car seat or bassinet for your newborn above both seats are reversible allowing your kids to face you face forward sit back to back or even face each other the city select two folds in one step when you pull up on levers on both sides of the frame the stroller collapses and locks automatically to open the stroller undo the lock on the side of the frame and lift it back into place with the purchase of car seat adapters you can attach a car seat to either position of the stroller or add two car seats for twins the city select two is compatible with car seats from brands including baby jogger britax kiko cleck cybex graco maxi cozy nuna and up a bb that s it for our review of the city select 2 available now at strollerria.com if you need help finding the stroller that s right for you email us at customercare at strollaria.com or leave a comment below thanks for watching you

title: Baby Jogger City Select 2, An Impartial Review Mechanics, Comfort, Use
description: In order to keep our recommendations up to date, we maintain a Buyer s Guide with a wide spectrum of models, and a lot of ...
transcript: today we re going to be looking at the city select 2 the newest iteration of baby jogger s long-standing tandem stroller we ve repaired several selects over the years but have generally shied away from covering the model on the channel as though baby jogger has always been one of our favorite three-wheeler manufacturers we ve generally found most of their four-wheelers the select included a bit lacking that being said there have been quite a few changes with the model and given the select s quite reasonable price of around 600 bucks in other parts of the world at least here in norway it s nearly double we decided it s worth giving this newest iteration a thorough rundown discussing the model s advantages and disadvantages in terms of child comfort ease of use performance and mechanics as well as in relation to which lifestyles and environments it will best suit and starting off with some stats the select 2 clocks in at a little over 12 kilos and folds down to 96 by 61 by 30 centimeters with the seat attached though it s worth noting that removing the seat will make it more compact the select 2 can take a little over 20 kilos in each seat and 7 kilos in the underslung shopping basket as far as child comfort is concerned the model has a bucket seat with an adjustable leg rest an inside width of 30 centimeters and a total length of just under 100 centimeters measured by adding together the lengths of the leg rest baseboard backboard and space beneath the canopy with both the leg rest and canopy in their most extended positions and as such will be most comfortable for children up until around 3 years old or so the textile quality on the model seats is decent for the price with nice padding feeling soft to the touch and including a multi-layered canopy that provides good sun coverage though i would nitpick the fact that the canopy hinges don t block open as tightly as i d have liked mechanically the positional adjustment mechanisms for both the recline and leg rest are quite sturdy and there s also the option of shortening the leg rest which can be useful for fine-tuning two-child configurations when it comes to parent comfort the select 2 has an adjustable handle with a height range between 103 and 109 centimeters and a shopping basket that while large enough can feel a bit difficult to access due to the positioning of the rear crossbar folding the select two is easy involving standard handle arm located triggers that feel lighter on the fingers than the setup on the original select and when folded the size of the model isn t too bad for getting in the trunk though as i already mentioned you may need to remove the seat as far as the overall feel of using the select 2 is concerned the activation mechanisms in general versus the wider market as opposed to just the previous select take a bit more force to use than is common but feel sturdy and well fitted and this feeling of sturdiness extends to the overall chassis as well where the model s thick bars and substantial reinforced connection points are even borderline chunky feeling though also durable and free of looseness driving wise the use of 7-inch front wheels and no rear frame suspension makes the select to very much a city model capable of tackling rougher urban conditions like gravel park paths and cobblestones but not the best to use off-road and the model s length also makes it a little heavy to steer and tip in particular in tandem configurations but also as a single child model at least in comparison to some of the better competing tandems on the wider market alright let s move on to the mechanics of the select two then going over the model from top to bottom where the handle uses a wire and pin telescopic setup for height adjustment that s built quite sturdily and has internal components separate from those used to activate the rotating folding mechanisms at the center of the chassis baby jogger s long used and quite durable easy fold system which remains essentially the same as on the previous iteration while the arm mounted folding triggers by contrast are a new and very welcome update replacing handles located directly at the point of the fold on the previous version that often ran into problems a few years down the road becoming heavy to pull and even sometimes breaking as far as the overall structure of the chassis is concerned the select 2 has solid horizontal support in the form of its thick crossbars and handle and is unlikely to suffer from any sort of symmetry problems as a result of loosening down the road not that the model is likely to loosen up that much anyway due to its rather heavy duty connection points moving down to the rear frame there s again no suspension which means that though the wheels and the structure of the chassis will sufficiently absorb most shocks from broken sidewalks and other lighter rough terrain truly bumpy ground will make driving a bit jittery looking at the brake system the select 2 marks a return to the sort of foot activated setup found on earlier baby jogger models though updated a bit both in the pedal and in that it s more enclosed which is a simpler and more durable brake system than the wire-based handle mounted static brake used on the original select lubricating the select 2 s brakes a couple of times a year and flushing out road salt if you live somewhere snowy are important to prevent rust and keep the channels free of pebbles and grit but beyond this my experience is that this sort of system tends to hold up well over the years and is easier to fix than wire based setups if problems do eventually pop up when it comes to the wheels the way they lock within the rear frame makes them unlikely to develop problems with the locking mechanisms though as with the brakes a little lubrication is definitely advised the composition of the tires on the select has been a little bit of an issue in the past in terms of holding up to wear from pebbles and rougher ground where they can get a bit ugly after a few years of use though from what i can find it looks like baby jogger has changed up the formula a bit and for the overall industry rubric s foam has also definitely gotten better in the last couple of years so hopefully this will be less of a problem with the select 2. looking lastly the front frame the select 2 has standard suspension built into the forks but no swivel locks which is quite unconventional but does reduce mechanical complexity as well as fit with the urban orientation of the model where smoother streets make swivel locks generally unnecessary the forks themselves sit nice and tight in the wheel housings at least right out of the box though it s important to note that the tight connection here results solely from the use of ball bearings and since there are no suspension pads or any other form of wobble protection besides these bearings keeping the axles lubricated with a thicker grease to prevent them from rusting to the bearing so that they can be removed will be crucial as the bearings are likely to loosen down the road and require replacement so should you consider getting the baby jogger city select 2 maybe my top criterion for judging tandem models has always been that they justify their added size and weight by being competitive in terms of either terrain capability or storage capacity in the single child mode versus other single child only models and though the select 2 is better than the original in this regard it still fails in these respects versus strollers like the boogaboo fox the upper baby cruise v2 or other tandems like the vista v2 or the nuna demigrow that being said however it is a lot cheaper than these models and when comparing the select 2 then to other strollers actually within its price class it does a lot better and thus provided that a tandem model is what you re looking for that price is a strong factor in your purchasing decision and that you live in a relatively smooth environment the select 2 is a model worth considering due to its acceptable price and weight the return to a foot mounted brake system and the fact that the engineering is significantly sturdier than what is common in its price class in any case we hope you found this video interesting and if you did we ask you subscribe as it helps us to continue making videos in the future in addition if you are currently shopping for a stroller we have a buyer s guide on our patreon page which lists a wide range of models that we recommend with a lot of technical and lifestyle related information you can find it by following the link in the description thank you you

title: BOB Alterrain and Alterrain Pro Stroller Review
description: Shop the BOB Alterrain and Alterrain Pro strollers at Strolleria ...
transcript: hi I m Amy owner of stroll area we re at the ABC Kids Expo in Las Vegas showing you the new Bob all-terrain and all-terrain Pro strollers the all-terrain Series is coming to stroller e accom in January 2020 if you have questions email us at customer care at stroller viacom or leave a comment below the new all-terrain series adds performance and convenience features to Bob s popular line of jogging strollers the all-terrain has air filled tires and a robust suspension system for the smoothest ride while running or going over tough terrain but it also makes for an everyday stroller with features like car seat compatibility and a one-handed fold bob is releasing two versions of the stroller the all terrain and the all-terrain pro which has upgraded features like a handbrake waterproof fabrics and a zippered basket both strollers will be released in January 2020 for 4.99 to 569 the all-terrain has the smoothest ride thanks to spring-loaded shocks in the frame of the stroller similar to those on a mountain bike as well as steel ball bearings in the wheels the front wheel can swivel or lock for added stability you can adjust the handlebar to 9 positions and recline the seat to multiple angles ranging from a near flat position to an upright position in addition to a large storage basket the stroller has five extra pockets including a place to keep your cell phone handy the all-terrain is the base model of the stroller while the all-terrain pro costs 50 more because of these added features a handbrake for speed control on Hills a zippered basket to keep your belongings secure reflective details on the wheels for added visibility a peekaboo window with both a plastic panel and ventilation and fabrics that are 100 waterproof to protect your child in any weather both the all-terrain an all-terrain Pro fold in one step using only one hand lift up the seat fabric and press the yellow button while twisting the bar the stroller folds and locks automatically and it stands when folded for easier lifting to unfold push the button on the side of the seat and lift the stroller back into place both strollers feature athletic fabrics and an ultra padded compression seat for added comfort the seat has a no rethread harness and a hip wrap to keep your child secure while you re running a peekaboo window in the canopy has ventilation and closes with magnets the all-terrain comes in softer colors with Milosh fabrics black teal lilac and grey the all-terrain pro has sporty ER colors and waterproof fabrics in black olive blue and lunar which includes glow-in-the-dark details on the canopy and basket you can turn your all-terrain or all terrain pro into a travel system by purchasing adapters to attach your car seat both strollers are compatible with car seats for Britax Bob Kiko Greco and peg pair go in summer 2020 Bob will also release adapters for nuna Cybex maxi Cosi and up of baby car seats that s it for our review of the Bob all-terrain and all terrain pro if you have questions about the all-terrain series email us at customer care at stroller e accom or leave a comment below thanks for watching

description: Shop BOB strollers at Strolleria here Questions about BOB strollers? Contact us at ...
transcript: hi I m Amy owner of stroller area in this video we ll compare the new Bob all-terrain and all-terrain pro strollers with a bob revolution flex 3.0 the revolution flex is available now at stroller viacom and the all-terrain series is coming in January 2020 if you have questions email us at customer care at stroller area comm or leave a comment below in early 2020 Bob is introducing a premium line of jogging strollers the all terrain and all terrain pro with new features like a one-handed fold and a modernized look bob is also continuing its bestseller the revolution flex 3.0 which has similar features at a lower price point the revolution flex is for 49 at stroller viacom while the all-terrain is 4.99 and all-terrain pro is 549 let s take a look at the differences all three Bob s have features like a padded seat with pockets a large storage basket a magnetic peekaboo window and car seat compatibility the all-terrain pro also has these features not seen on the all terrain or revolution flex a handbrake for speed control on hills a zippered basket to keep your belongings secure reflective details on the wheels for added visibility a peekaboo window with both a plastic panel and ventilation and fabrics that are 100 waterproof to protect your child in any weather all Bob strollers have sturdy air filled tires with suspension that provides a smooth ride if you re running or navigating tough terrain the suspension absorbs shock and minimizes side-to-side movement for your child the all-terrain and revolution flex strollers have an equally smooth ride but the handbrake on the all-terrain pro helps with maneuverability for serious runners both the all-terrain an all-terrain pro fold in one step using only one hand lift up the seat fabric and press the yellow button while twisting the bar the stroller folds and locks automatically and it stands when folded for easier lifting to unfold push the button on the side of the seat and lift the stroller back into place the revolution flex takes two steps and two hands to fold pull up on the triggers on both sides of the frame to fold the seat forward then pull the red handle to complete the fold unlike the all-terrain the revolution flex is not staying unfolded and you ll need to lock it manually by connecting the red buckles compared to the all-terrain versions the revolution flex is a little more compact when folded the all-terrain strollers have more premium athleisure fabrics while the fabrics on the revolution flex have a more basic look and feel the all-terrain pro is the only bob stroller with 100 waterproof fabrics similar to those on rain jackets the all-terrain comes in softer colors with melange fabrics black teal lilac and grey the all-terrain pro has 40 year colors and waterproof fabrics in black olive blue and lunar which includes glow-in-the-dark details on the canopy and basket for 2020 the revolution flex comes in two colors graphite and glow-in-the-dark lunar that s it for our comparison of the Bob all-terrain all-terrain pro and revolution flex if you have questions or need help finding the stroller that s right for you email us at customer care at stroller viacom or leave a comment below thanks for watching

title: Silver Cross Coast Stroller Review
description: Shop the Silver Cross Coast at Strolleria here See the ...
transcript: hi I m Amy owner of stroll area and in this video I ll show you the new silver cross coast stroller the coast will be available in late 2018 from stroller area calm where we offer free shipping no sales tax and registry rewards if you have questions about the coast feel free to email us at customer care at stroller viacom or leave a comment below the coast is the second single to double stroller from silver cross the british company that made the very first baby carriage in 1877 silver cross also makes the wave one of the highest quality convertible strollers on the market the coast is a lower priced more compact stroller that still looks and feels luxurious and still expands to a double stroller with the addition of a second seat like the wave the coast comes with a bassinet that s approved for overnight sleeping and it s compatible with infant car seats from several different brands the silver cross coast will be available in late 2018 for 9.99 the silvercross wave and coast have a lot in common like similar configurations and the same weight capacity but the coast is more compact and it cost three hundred dollars less than the wave for a few reasons the coast comes with fewer included items for example the stroller seat and bassinet share the same canopy and bumper bar for the coast while the wave includes two of everything unlike the waved the coast can t become a double stroller right out of the box using the stroller seat investment the wave includes top-of-the-line finishes for example a hand-sewn leather handlebar and quilted bassinet interior the coast fabrics are machine fabricated and less detailed the coast is also four pounds lighter and one inch shorter than the wave with smaller wheels finally the look of the coast is a little more edgy compared to the classic elegance of the wave the coast is available in three colors all of which include a black frame the coast fabrics feature an over printed texture that gives the stroller a modern artistic look the colors include Flint a dark grey limestone a lighter gray and tundra and earthy brown the Coast offers 17 configurations to meet your needs as your child and your family grow the seat is reversible so that your baby can face you when they re younger and forward when they re older the coast features multiple recline positions and an adjustable handlebar footrest and canopy to keep both baby and parent comfortable the coast can be used in numerous configurations as a stroller for a single child siblings or twins using the main stroller seat the lower seat which is called the tandem seat the bassinet or a car seat as a double stroller you can use the coast with the stroller seats facing either direction or back to back the bassinet in the upper position or two car seats for twins to fold the coast pull up on the triggers and lower the stroller forward until it automatically locks to unfold it simply undo the lock and pull the stroller back into place stepping on the rear axle if necessary the silver cross coast can be paired with several infant car seats to create a convenient travel system the stroller includes a set of car seat adapters that can be used with car seats from nuna maxi Cosi or Cybex that concludes our review of the silver cross coast stroller the coast will be available in late 2018 at stroll area calm where we offer free shipping no sales tax and registry rewards if you have questions about the coast or need help finding a stroller that s right for you email us at customer care at stroller area
